pli-tv-kd4:0.3.eng: The chapter on the invitation ceremony

pli-tv-kd4:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-kd4:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-kd4:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā sandiṭṭhā sambhattā bhikkhū kosalesu janapade aññatarasmiṃ āvāse vassaṃ upagacchiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd4:1.1.2.eng: At that time in a certain monastery in the Kosalan country a number of monks who were friends had entered rainy-season residence together.

pli-tv-kd4:1.1.4.pli: “kena nu kho mayaṃ upāyena samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā phāsukaṃ vassaṃ vaseyyāma, na ca piṇḍakena kilameyyāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd4:1.1.4.eng: “How can we have a comfortable rains, live in peace and harmony, and get almsfood without trouble?”

pli-tv-kd4:1.2.2.pli: “sace kho mayaṃ aññamaññaṃ neva ālapeyyāma na sallapeyyāma—

pli-tv-kd4:1.2.3.pli: yo paṭhamaṃ gāmato piṇḍāya paṭikkameyya so āsanaṃ paññapeyya, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipeyya, avakkārapātiṃ dhovitvā upaṭṭhāpeyya, pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpeyya;
pli-tv-kd4:1.2.3.eng: Whoever returns first from almsround in the village should prepare the seats, and set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet. He should wash the bowl for leftovers and put it back out, and set out water for drinking and water for washing.

pli-tv-kd4:1.3.1.pli: yo pacchā gāmato piṇḍāya paṭikkameyya, sacassa bhuttāvaseso, sace ākaṅkheyya bhuñjeyya, no ce ākaṅkheyya appaharite vā chaḍḍeyya, appāṇake vā udake opilāpeyya;
pli-tv-kd4:1.3.1.eng: Whoever returns last from almsround may eat whatever is left over, or he should discard it where there are no cultivated plants or in water without life.
pli-tv-kd4:1.3.1.comm: Harita could in principle refer to all plants, but it is elsewhere defined as what is cultivated, see Bu Pc 19:2.1.14 and Bi Pc 9:2.1.14.

pli-tv-kd4:1.3.2.pli: so āsanaṃ uddhareyya, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ paṭisāmeyya, avakkārapātiṃ dhovitvā paṭisāmeyya, pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ paṭisāmeyya, bhattaggaṃ sammajjeyya;
pli-tv-kd4:1.3.2.eng: He should put away the seats and also the foot stool, the foot scraper, and the water for washing the feet. He should wash the bowl for leftovers and put it away, put away the water for drinking and the water for washing, and sweep the dining hall.

pli-tv-kd4:1.4.1.pli: yo passeyya pānīyaghaṭaṃ vā paribhojanīyaghaṭaṃ vā vaccaghaṭaṃ vā rittaṃ tucchaṃ so upaṭṭhāpeyya;
pli-tv-kd4:1.4.1.eng: Whoever sees that the pot for drinking water, the pot for washing water, or the waterpot in the restroom is empty should fill it.

pli-tv-kd4:1.4.2.pli: sacassa hoti avisayhaṃ, hatthavikārena dutiyaṃ āmantetvā hatthavilaṅghakena upaṭṭhāpeyya;
pli-tv-kd4:1.4.2.eng: If he can’t do it by himself, he should call someone over by hand signal, and they should fill it together.

pli-tv-kd4:1.4.3.eng: He shouldn’t speak because of that.

pli-tv-kd4:1.4.4.pli: evaṃ kho mayaṃ samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā phāsukaṃ vassaṃ vaseyyāma, na ca piṇḍakena kilameyyāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd4:1.4.4.eng: In this way we’ll have a comfortable rains, live in peace and harmony, and get almsfood without trouble.”

pli-tv-kd4:1.5.1.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū aññamaññaṃ neva ālapiṃsu, na sallapiṃsu.

pli-tv-kd4:1.5.2.pli: Yo paṭhamaṃ gāmato piṇḍāya paṭikkamati, so āsanaṃ paññapeti, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipati, avakkārapātiṃ dhovitvā upaṭṭhāpeti, pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpeti.

pli-tv-kd4:1.6.1.pli: Yo pacchā gāmato piṇḍāya paṭikkamati, sace hoti bhuttāvaseso, sace ākaṅkhati bhuñjati, no ce ākaṅkhati appaharite vā chaḍḍeti, appāṇake vā udake opilāpeti;

pli-tv-kd4:1.6.2.pli: so āsanaṃ uddharati, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ paṭisāmeti, avakkārapātiṃ dhovitvā paṭisāmeti, pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ paṭisāmeti, bhattaggaṃ sammajjati.

pli-tv-kd4:1.7.1.pli: Yo passati pānīyaghaṭaṃ vā paribhojanīyaghaṭaṃ vā vaccaghaṭaṃ vā rittaṃ tucchaṃ so upaṭṭhāpeti.

pli-tv-kd4:1.7.2.pli: Sacassa hoti avisayhaṃ, hatthavikārena dutiyaṃ āmantetvā hatthavilaṅghakena upaṭṭhāpeti, na tveva tappaccayā vācaṃ bhindati.

pli-tv-kd4:1.8.1.pli: Āciṇṇaṃ kho panetaṃ vassaṃvuṭṭhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bhagavantaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:1.8.1.eng: Now it was the custom for monks who had completed the rainy-season residence to go and see the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd4:1.8.2.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū vassaṃvuṭṭhā temāsaccayena senāsanaṃ saṃsāmetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena sāvatthi tena pakkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd4:1.8.2.eng: And so, when the three months were over and they had completed the rains residence, they put their dwellings in order, took their bowls and robes, and set out for Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-kd4:1.8.3.pli: Anupubbena yena sāvatthi jetavanaṃ anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāmo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd4:1.8.3.eng: When they eventually arrived, they went to the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery. There they approached the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd4:1.8.4.pli: Āciṇṇaṃ kho panetaṃ buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ āgantukehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ paṭisammodituṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:1.8.4.eng: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly-arrived monks,

pli-tv-kd4:1.9.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā te bhikkhū etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd4:1.9.2.eng: “I hope you’re keeping well, monks, I hope you’re getting by?

pli-tv-kd4:1.9.3.pli: kacci samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā phāsukaṃ vassaṃ vasittha, na ca piṇḍakena kilamitthā”ti?
pli-tv-kd4:1.9.3.eng: I hope you had a comfortable and harmonious rains, and got almsfood without trouble?”

pli-tv-kd4:1.9.4.eng: “We’re keeping well, sir, we’re getting by.

pli-tv-kd4:1.9.5.pli: Samaggā ca mayaṃ, bhante, sammodamānā avivadamānā phāsukaṃ vassaṃ vasimhā, na ca piṇḍakena kilamimhā”ti.
pli-tv-kd4:1.9.5.eng: We had a comfortable and harmonious rains, and got almsfood without trouble.”

pli-tv-kd4:1.10.1.pli: Jānantāpi tathāgatā pucchanti, jānantāpi na pucchanti.
pli-tv-kd4:1.10.1.eng: When Buddhas know what is going on, sometimes they ask and sometimes not.

pli-tv-kd4:1.10.2.pli: Kālaṃ viditvā pucchanti, kālaṃ viditvā na pucchanti.
pli-tv-kd4:1.10.2.eng: They know the right time to ask and when not to ask.

pli-tv-kd4:1.10.3.eng: Buddhas ask when it is beneficial, otherwise not,

pli-tv-kd4:1.10.4.eng: for Buddhas are incapable of doing what is unbeneficial.
pli-tv-kd4:1.10.4.comm: “Incapable of doing” renders setughāta, literally, “destroyed the bridge”. Sp 1.16: Setu vuccati maggo, maggeneva tādisassa vacanassa ghāto, samucchedoti vuttaṁ hoti, “The path is called the bridge. What is said is that there is the destruction and cutting off of such speech by the path.” The commentary seems to take setu, “bridge”, as a reference to the eightfold path. I prefer to understand “bridge” as a metaphor for access, that is, the Buddhas no longer have the possibility of doing what is unbeneficial.

pli-tv-kd4:1.10.5.pli: Dvīhākārehi buddhā bhagavanto bhikkhū paṭipucchanti— “dhammaṃ vā desessāma, sāvakānaṃ vā sikkhāpadaṃ paññapessāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd4:1.10.5.eng: Buddhas question the monks for two reasons: to give a teaching or to lay down a training rule.

pli-tv-kd4:1.10.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā te bhikkhū etadavoca— “yathākathaṃ pana tumhe, bhikkhave, samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā phāsukaṃ vassaṃ vasittha, na ca piṇḍakena kilamitthā”ti.
pli-tv-kd4:1.10.6.eng: So the Buddha said to those monks, “In what way, monks, did you have a harmonious and comfortable rains? And how did you get almsfood without trouble?”

pli-tv-kd4:1.11.1.pli: “Idha mayaṃ, bhante, sambahulā sandiṭṭhā sambhattā bhikkhū kosalesu janapade aññatarasmiṃ āvāse vassaṃ upagacchimhā.

pli-tv-kd4:1.11.3.pli: ‘kena nu kho mayaṃ upāyena samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā phāsukaṃ vassaṃ vaseyyāma, na ca piṇḍakena kilameyyāmā’ti.

pli-tv-kd4:1.11.5.pli: ‘sace kho mayaṃ aññamaññaṃ neva ālapeyyāma na sallapeyyāma—

pli-tv-kd4:1.11.6.pli: yo paṭhamaṃ gāmato piṇḍāya paṭikkameyya so āsanaṃ paññapeyya, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipeyya, avakkārapātiṃ dhovitvā upaṭṭhāpeyya, pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpeyya;

pli-tv-kd4:1.11.7.pli: yo pacchā gāmato piṇḍāya paṭikkameyya, sacassa bhuttāvaseso, sace ākaṅkheyya bhuñjeyya, no ce ākaṅkheyya appaharite vā chaḍḍeyya, appāṇake vā udake opilāpeyya;

pli-tv-kd4:1.11.8.pli: so āsanaṃ uddhareyya, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ paṭisāmeyya, avakkārapātiṃ dhovitvā paṭisāmeyya, pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ paṭisāmeyya, bhattaggaṃ sammajjeyya;

pli-tv-kd4:1.11.9.pli: yo passeyya pānīyaghaṭaṃ vā paribhojanīyaghaṭaṃ vā vaccaghaṭaṃ vā rittaṃ tucchaṃ so upaṭṭhāpeyya;

pli-tv-kd4:1.11.10.pli: sacassa hoti avisayhaṃ, hatthavikārena dutiyaṃ āmantetvā hatthavilaṅghakena upaṭṭhāpeyya;

pli-tv-kd4:1.11.12.pli: evaṃ kho mayaṃ samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā phāsukaṃ vassaṃ vaseyyāma, na ca piṇḍakena kilameyyāmā’ti.

pli-tv-kd4:1.11.13.pli: Atha kho mayaṃ, bhante, aññamaññaṃ neva ālapimhā na sallapimhā.

pli-tv-kd4:1.11.14.pli: Yo paṭhamaṃ gāmato piṇḍāya paṭikkamati so āsanaṃ paññapeti, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipati, avakkārapātiṃ dhovitvā upaṭṭhāpeti, pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpeti.

pli-tv-kd4:1.11.15.pli: Yo pacchā gāmato piṇḍāya paṭikkamati, sace hoti bhuttāvaseso, sace ākaṅkhati bhuñjati, no ce ākaṅkhati appaharite vā chaḍḍeti, appāṇake vā udake opilāpeti, so āsanaṃ uddharati, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ paṭisāmeti, avakkārapātiṃ dhovitvā paṭisāmeti, pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ paṭisāmeti, bhattaggaṃ sammajjati.

pli-tv-kd4:1.11.16.pli: Yo passati pānīyaghaṭaṃ vā paribhojanīyaghaṭaṃ vā vaccaghaṭaṃ vā rittaṃ tucchaṃ so upaṭṭhāpeti.

pli-tv-kd4:1.11.17.pli: Sacassa hoti avisayhaṃ, hatthavikārena dutiyaṃ āmantetvā hatthavilaṅghakena upaṭṭhāpeti, na tveva tappaccayā vācaṃ bhindati.

pli-tv-kd4:1.11.18.pli: Evaṃ kho mayaṃ, bhante, samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā phāsukaṃ vassaṃ vasimhā, na ca piṇḍakena kilamimhā”ti.

pli-tv-kd4:1.12.1.eng: When they had told him, the Buddha addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd4:1.12.2.pli: “aphāsuññeva kirame, bhikkhave, moghapurisā vuṭṭhā samānā phāsumhā vuṭṭhāti paṭijānanti.
pli-tv-kd4:1.12.2.eng: “While being uncomfortable, these foolish men claim they were living in comfort.

pli-tv-kd4:1.12.3.pli: Pasusaṃvāsaññeva kirame, bhikkhave, moghapurisā vuṭṭhā samānā phāsumhā vuṭṭhāti paṭijānanti.
pli-tv-kd4:1.12.3.eng: While living together like animals, they claim they were living in comfort.

pli-tv-kd4:1.12.4.pli: Eḷakasaṃvāsaññeva kirame, bhikkhave, moghapurisā vuṭṭhā samānā phāsumhā vuṭṭhāti paṭijānanti.
pli-tv-kd4:1.12.4.eng: While living together like sheep, they claim they were living in comfort.

pli-tv-kd4:1.12.5.pli: Sapattasaṃvāsaññeva kirame, bhikkhave, moghapurisā vuṭṭhā samānā phāsumhā vuṭṭhāti paṭijānanti.
pli-tv-kd4:1.12.5.eng: While living together like enemies, they claim they were living in comfort.

pli-tv-kd4:1.12.6.pli: Kathañhi nāmime, bhikkhave, moghapurisā mūgabbataṃ titthiyasamādānaṃ samādiyissanti.
pli-tv-kd4:1.12.6.eng: How could these foolish men take a vow of silence, like the monastics of other religions?

pli-tv-kd4:1.13.2.pli: vigarahitvā dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd4:1.13.2.eng: After rebuking them and giving a teaching, he addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd4:1.13.3.eng: “You shouldn’t take a vow of silence, like the monastics of other religions.

pli-tv-kd4:1.13.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd4:1.13.5.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, vassaṃvuṭṭhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ tīhi ṭhānehi pavāretuṃ—
pli-tv-kd4:1.13.5.eng: When you have completed the rainy-season residence, you should invite the monks to correct you in regard to three things:

pli-tv-kd4:1.13.6.pli: diṭṭhena vā sutena vā parisaṅkāya vā.
pli-tv-kd4:1.13.6.eng: what has been seen, heard, or suspected.

pli-tv-kd4:1.13.7.pli: Sā vo bhavissati aññamaññānulomatā āpattivuṭṭhānatā vinayapurekkhāratā.
pli-tv-kd4:1.13.7.eng: This will help you live with one another in the proper way, help you clear yourself of offenses, and help you prioritize the training.
pli-tv-kd4:1.13.7.comm: “Training” renders vinaya. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.1.eng: And you should do the invitation ceremony like this.
pli-tv-kd4:1.14.1.comm: For the rendering “Should do the invitation ceremony”, see pavāraṇā in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.2.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.5.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should do the invitation ceremony.’

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.6.pli: Therena bhikkhunā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:1.14.6.eng: The most senior monk should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
pli-tv-kd4:1.14.6.comm: Therena bhikkhunā could be rendered “a/the senior monk”. Yet the point is that only the most senior member of the Sangha should use the semi-informal address āvuso, whereas everyone else should use the formal equivalent bhante.

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.7.pli: ‘saṅghaṃ, āvuso, pavāremi diṭṭhena vā sutena vā parisaṅkāya vā.
pli-tv-kd4:1.14.7.eng: ‘I invite the Sangha to correct me concerning what you have seen, heard, or suspect.

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.8.eng: Please correct me, venerables, out of compassion.
pli-tv-kd4:1.14.8.comm: “Correct” renders vadantu. See vadati in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.9.eng: If I see a fault, I will make amends.

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.10.pli: Dutiyampi, āvuso, saṅghaṃ pavāremi diṭṭhena vā sutena vā parisaṅkāya vā.
pli-tv-kd4:1.14.10.eng: For the second time, I invite the Sangha to correct me concerning what you have seen, heard, or suspect.

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.11.eng: Please correct me, venerables, out of compassion.

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.12.eng: If I see a fault, I will make amends.

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.13.pli: Tatiyampi, āvuso, saṅghaṃ pavāremi diṭṭhena vā sutena vā parisaṅkāya vā.
pli-tv-kd4:1.14.13.eng: For the third time, I invite the Sangha to correct me concerning what you have seen, heard, or suspect.

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.14.eng: Please correct me, venerables, out of compassion.

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.15.eng: If I see a fault, I will make amends.’

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.16.pli: Navakena bhikkhunā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:1.14.16.eng: Each junior monk should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
pli-tv-kd4:1.14.16.comm: Navakena bhikkhunā could be rendered “a/the junior monk”. Yet the point here is that only the most senior member of the Sangha should use the semi-informal address āvuso, whereas everyone else should use the formal equivalent bhante. In this context, then, navaka does not have its normal meaning of “newly ordained” monk, but rather refers to any monk junior to the most senior one.

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.17.pli: ‘saṅghaṃ, bhante, pavāremi diṭṭhena vā sutena vā parisaṅkāya vā.
pli-tv-kd4:1.14.17.eng: ‘I invite the Sangha to correct me concerning what you have seen, heard, or suspect.

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.18.eng: Please correct me, venerables, out of compassion.

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.19.eng: If I see a fault, I will make amends.

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.20.eng: For the second time, I invite the Sangha to correct me concerning what you have seen, heard, or suspect. Please correct me, venerables, out of compassion. If I see a fault, I will make amends.

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.21.pli: tatiyampi, bhante, saṅghaṃ pavāremi diṭṭhena vā sutena vā parisaṅkāya vā.
pli-tv-kd4:1.14.21.eng: For the third time, I invite the Sangha to correct me concerning what you have seen, heard, or suspect.

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.22.eng: Please correct me, venerables, out of compassion.

pli-tv-kd4:1.14.23.eng: If I see a fault, I will make amends.’”

pli-tv-kd4:2.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū theresu bhikkhūsu ukkuṭikaṃ nisinnesu pavārayamānesu āsanesu acchanti.
pli-tv-kd4:2.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards the monks from the group of six remained seated while the senior monks were inviting correction, squatting on their heels.

pli-tv-kd4:2.1.2.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd4:2.1.2.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd4:2.1.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū theresu bhikkhūsu ukkuṭikaṃ nisinnesu pavārayamānesu āsanesu acchissantī”ti.
pli-tv-kd4:2.1.3.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six act like this?”

pli-tv-kd4:2.1.4.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd4:2.1.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhū theresu bhikkhūsu ukkuṭikaṃ nisinnesu pavārayamānesu āsanesu acchantī”ti?
pli-tv-kd4:2.1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the monks from the group of six are acting like this?”

pli-tv-kd4:2.1.8.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā theresu bhikkhūsu ukkuṭikaṃ nisinnesu pavārayamānesu āsanesu acchissanti.
pli-tv-kd4:2.1.8.eng: “How can those foolish men act like this?”

pli-tv-kd4:2.1.9.pli: Netaṃ, bhikkhave, appasannānaṃ vā pasādāya, pasannānaṃ vā bhiyyobhāvāya …pe…

pli-tv-kd4:2.1.11.eng: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd4:2.1.12.pli: “na, bhikkhave, theresu bhikkhūsu ukkuṭikaṃ nisinnesu pavārayamānesu āsanesu acchitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:2.1.12.eng: “You shouldn’t remain seated while the senior monks are inviting correction, squatting on their heels.

pli-tv-kd4:2.1.13.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd4:2.1.14.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sabbeheva ukkuṭikaṃ nisinnehi pavāretun”ti.
pli-tv-kd4:2.1.14.eng: Everyone should squat on their heels during the invitation ceremony.”

pli-tv-kd4:2.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro thero jarādubbalo yāva sabbe pavārentīti ukkuṭikaṃ nisinno āgamayamāno mucchito papati.
pli-tv-kd4:2.2.1.eng: On one occasion, while squatting on his heels and waiting for everyone to finish, a senior monk who was weak from old age fainted and fell over.

pli-tv-kd4:2.2.3.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tadamantarā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīdituṃ yāva pavāreti, pavāretvā āsane nisīditun”ti.
pli-tv-kd4:2.2.3.eng: “You should squat on your heels until you have invited correction. Once you have invited, you may sit down.”

pli-tv-kd4:3.1.5.eng: the fourteenth and the fifteenth day of the lunar half-month.”

pli-tv-kd4:3.2.2.eng: “How many kinds of invitation procedures are there?”

pli-tv-kd4:3.2.5.eng: The invitation procedure that is illegitimate and has an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd4:3.2.6.eng: The invitation procedure that is illegitimate but has a complete assembly.

pli-tv-kd4:3.2.7.eng: The invitation procedure that is legitimate but has an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd4:3.2.8.eng: The invitation procedure that is legitimate and has a complete assembly.

pli-tv-kd4:3.2.9.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yadidaṃ adhammena vaggaṃ pavāraṇakammaṃ, na, bhikkhave, evarūpaṃ pavāraṇakammaṃ kātabbaṃ;

pli-tv-kd4:3.2.10.pli: na ca mayā evarūpaṃ pavāraṇakammaṃ anuññātaṃ.

pli-tv-kd4:3.2.11.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yadidaṃ adhammena samaggaṃ pavāraṇakammaṃ, na, bhikkhave, evarūpaṃ pavāraṇakammaṃ kātabbaṃ;

pli-tv-kd4:3.2.12.pli: na ca mayā evarūpaṃ pavāraṇakammaṃ anuññātaṃ.

pli-tv-kd4:3.2.13.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yadidaṃ dhammena vaggaṃ pavāraṇakammaṃ, na, bhikkhave, evarūpaṃ pavāraṇakammaṃ kātabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd4:3.2.13.eng: and third of these shouldn’t be done;

pli-tv-kd4:3.2.14.pli: na ca mayā evarūpaṃ pavāraṇakammaṃ anuññātaṃ.

pli-tv-kd4:3.2.15.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yadidaṃ dhammena samaggaṃ pavāraṇakammaṃ, evarūpaṃ, bhikkhave, pavāraṇakammaṃ kātabbaṃ;

pli-tv-kd4:3.2.17.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, evarūpaṃ pavāraṇakammaṃ karissāma yadidaṃ dhammena samagganti, evañhi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd4:3.2.17.eng: Therefore, monks, you should train like this: ‘We will do invitation procedures that are legitimate and have a complete assembly.’”

pli-tv-kd4:3.3.0.eng: 3. The allowance to pass on the invitation

pli-tv-kd4:3.3.3.eng: for the Sangha to do the invitation ceremony.”

pli-tv-kd4:3.3.4.pli: Evaṃ vutte, aññataro bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd4:3.3.4.eng: A monk said to the Buddha,

pli-tv-kd4:3.3.5.eng: “Sir, there’s a sick monk. He hasn’t come.”

pli-tv-kd4:3.3.6.eng: “A sick monk should pass on his invitation.

pli-tv-kd4:3.3.7.eng: And he should do it like this.

pli-tv-kd4:3.3.8.pli: tena gilānena bhikkhunā ekaṃ bhikkhuṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:3.3.8.eng: The sick monk should approach a monk, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, and squat on his heels. He should then raise his joined palms and say,

pli-tv-kd4:3.3.9.pli: ‘pavāraṇaṃ dammi, pavāraṇaṃ me hara, pavāraṇaṃ me ārocehi, mamatthāya pavārehī’ti kāyena viññāpeti, vācāya viññāpeti, kāyena vācāya viññāpeti, dinnā hoti pavāraṇā;
pli-tv-kd4:3.3.9.eng: ‘I pass on my invitation; please convey my invitation; please announce my invitation; please invite correction on my behalf.’ If he makes this understood by body, by speech, or by body and speech, then the invitation has been passed on.

pli-tv-kd4:3.3.10.pli: na kāyena viññāpeti, na vācāya viññāpeti, na kāyena vācāya viññāpeti, na dinnā hoti pavāraṇā.
pli-tv-kd4:3.3.10.eng: If he doesn’t make this understood by body, by speech, or by body and speech, then the invitation hasn’t been passed on.

pli-tv-kd4:3.4.1.eng: If he’s able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd4:3.4.2.pli: No ce labhetha, so, bhikkhave, gilāno bhikkhu mañcena vā pīṭhena vā saṅghamajjhe ānetvā pavāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:3.4.2.eng: If he’s not, then the sick monk should be brought into the midst of the Sangha together with his bed or bench. They can then do the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:3.4.3.eng: But if the one who is nursing him says,

pli-tv-kd4:3.4.4.pli: ‘sace kho mayaṃ gilānaṃ ṭhānā cāvessāma, ābādho vā abhivaḍḍhissati, kālaṅkiriyā vā bhavissatī’ti na, bhikkhave, gilāno bhikkhu ṭhānā cāvetabbo.
pli-tv-kd4:3.4.4.eng: ‘If we move him, his illness will get worse, or he’ll die,’ then the sick monk shouldn’t be moved.

pli-tv-kd4:3.4.5.eng: The Sangha should go to where the sick monk is and do the invitation ceremony there.

pli-tv-kd4:3.4.6.eng: You shouldn’t do the invitation ceremony with an incomplete sangha.

pli-tv-kd4:3.4.7.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd4:4.1.0.eng: 4. Discussion on being seized by relatives, etc.

pli-tv-kd4:4.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ tadahu pavāraṇāya ñātakā gaṇhiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd4:4.1.1.eng: At one time on the invitation day, a certain monk was seized by his relatives.

pli-tv-kd4:4.1.3.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuṃ tadahu pavāraṇāya ñātakā gaṇhanti.
pli-tv-kd4:4.1.3.eng: “If a monk is seized by his relatives on the invitation day,

pli-tv-kd4:4.1.4.eng: other monks should say to those relatives,

pli-tv-kd4:4.1.5.pli: ‘iṅgha tumhe āyasmanto imaṃ bhikkhuṃ muhuttaṃ muñcatha, yāvāyaṃ bhikkhu pavāretī’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:4.1.5.eng: ‘Listen, please release this monk for a short time so that he can take part in the invitation ceremony.’

pli-tv-kd4:4.2.1.eng: If they’re able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd4:4.2.2.pli: No ce labhetha, te ñātakā bhikkhūhi evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd4:4.2.2.eng: If not, they should say to those relatives,

pli-tv-kd4:4.2.3.pli: ‘iṅgha tumhe āyasmanto muhuttaṃ ekamantaṃ hotha, yāvāyaṃ bhikkhu pavāraṇaṃ detī’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:4.2.3.eng: ‘Listen, please step aside for a moment while this monk passes on his invitation.’

pli-tv-kd4:4.2.4.eng: If they’re able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd4:4.2.5.pli: No ce labhetha, te ñātakā bhikkhūhi evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd4:4.2.5.eng: If not, they should say to those relatives,

pli-tv-kd4:4.2.6.pli: ‘iṅgha tumhe āyasmanto imaṃ bhikkhuṃ muhuttaṃ nissīmaṃ netha, yāva saṅgho pavāretī’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:4.2.6.eng: ‘Listen, please take this monk outside the monastery zone for a short time while the Sangha does the invitation ceremony.’

pli-tv-kd4:4.2.7.eng: If they’re able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd4:4.2.8.pli: No ce labhetha, na tveva vaggena saṅghena pavāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:4.2.8.eng: If not, you shouldn’t do the invitation ceremony with an incomplete sangha.

pli-tv-kd4:4.2.9.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd4:4.3.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuṃ tadahu pavāraṇāya rājāno gaṇhanti …pe…
pli-tv-kd4:4.3.1.eng: If on the invitation day a monk is seized by kings,

pli-tv-kd4:4.3.4.eng: or by enemies of the monks,
pli-tv-kd4:4.3.4.comm: “Enemies of monks” is a translation of bhikkhupaccatthikā. At Bu Pj 1:9.3.1, I have translated the same compound as “enemy monks”. In that rule this seems required because various people who are acting as enemies of monks are mentioned separately, such as kings, bandits, and scoundrels. Moreover, all of these are compounded with paccatthikā: bhikkhupaccatthikā, rājapaccatthikā, and so on. Since it seems reasonable to assume that all these compounds have the same structure, it follows that they should all be read as “enemies who are so-and-so” rather than “enemies of so-and-so”. This understanding is confirmed by Sp 1.58: bhikkhū eva paccatthikā bhikkhupaccatthikā, “Bhikkhupaccatthikā are just monks who are enemies.” In the present context, however, this interpretation does not seem to work. If bhikkhupaccatthikā refers to enemies who are monks, then they would have to be invited to take part in the ceremony, or some other arrangement would have to be made, but nothing is said about this in either the Pali or the commentaries. Moreover, kings, bandits, and scoundrels are in this case not compounded with paccatthikā, as they are in Bu Pj 1. I therefore conclude that the meaning here must be “enemies of monks”.

pli-tv-kd4:4.3.5.eng: other monks should say to those enemies,

pli-tv-kd4:4.3.6.pli: ‘iṅgha tumhe āyasmanto imaṃ bhikkhuṃ muhuttaṃ muñcatha, yāvāyaṃ bhikkhu pavāretī’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:4.3.6.eng: ‘Listen, please release this monk for a short time, so that he can take part in the invitation ceremony.’

pli-tv-kd4:4.3.7.eng: If they’re able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd4:4.3.8.eng: If not, they should say to those enemies,

pli-tv-kd4:4.3.9.pli: ‘iṅgha tumhe āyasmanto muhuttaṃ ekamantaṃ hotha, yāvāyaṃ bhikkhu pavāraṇaṃ detī’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:4.3.9.eng: ‘Listen, please step aside for a moment while this monk passes on his invitation.’

pli-tv-kd4:4.3.10.eng: If they’re able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd4:4.3.11.pli: No ce labhetha, te bhikkhupaccatthikā bhikkhūhi evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd4:4.3.11.eng: If not, they should say to those enemies,

pli-tv-kd4:4.3.12.pli: ‘iṅgha tumhe āyasmanto imaṃ bhikkhuṃ muhuttaṃ nissīmaṃ netha, yāva saṅgho pavāretī’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:4.3.12.eng: ‘Listen, please take this monk outside the monastery zone for a short time while the Sangha does the invitation ceremony.’

pli-tv-kd4:4.3.13.eng: If they’re able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd4:5.1.0.eng: 5. Various kinds of invitation ceremonies for the Sangha, etc.

pli-tv-kd4:5.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahu pavāraṇāya pañca bhikkhū viharanti.
pli-tv-kd4:5.1.1.eng: At one time on the invitation day, there were five monks staying in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd4:5.1.3.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd4:5.1.4.eng: that the invitation ceremony should be done with a sangha.

pli-tv-kd4:5.1.6.eng: So how should we do the invitation ceremony?”

pli-tv-kd4:5.1.8.eng: “When there are five of you, you should do the invitation ceremony in the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd4:5.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahu pavāraṇāya cattāro bhikkhū viharanti.
pli-tv-kd4:5.2.1.eng: At one time on the invitation day, there were four monks staying in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd4:5.2.3.eng: “The Buddha has instructed that the invitation ceremony should be done in the Sangha when there are five monks.

pli-tv-kd4:5.2.4.eng: But there’s only four of us.

pli-tv-kd4:5.2.5.eng: So how should we do the invitation ceremony?”

pli-tv-kd4:5.2.7.eng: “When there are four of you, you should do the invitation ceremony with one another.

pli-tv-kd4:5.3.1.eng: And you should do it like this.

pli-tv-kd4:5.3.2.pli: Byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena te bhikkhū ñāpetabbā—
pli-tv-kd4:5.3.2.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform those monks:

pli-tv-kd4:5.3.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask you to listen.

pli-tv-kd4:5.3.5.eng: If the venerables are ready, we should do the invitation ceremony with one another.’

pli-tv-kd4:5.3.6.pli: Therena bhikkhunā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā te bhikkhū evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd4:5.3.6.eng: The most senior monk should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say to the other monks:

pli-tv-kd4:5.3.7.pli: ‘ahaṃ, āvuso, āyasmante pavāremi diṭṭhena vā sutena vā parisaṅkāya vā.
pli-tv-kd4:5.3.7.eng: ‘I invite you to correct me concerning what you have seen, heard, or suspect.

pli-tv-kd4:5.3.8.eng: Please correct me, venerables, out of compassion.

pli-tv-kd4:5.3.9.eng: If I see a fault, I will make amends.

pli-tv-kd4:5.3.11.pli: tatiyampi ahaṃ, āvuso, āyasmante pavāremi diṭṭhena vā sutena vā parisaṅkāya vā.
pli-tv-kd4:5.3.11.eng: For the third time, I invite you to correct me concerning what you have seen, heard, or suspect.

pli-tv-kd4:5.3.12.eng: Please correct me, venerables, out of compassion.

pli-tv-kd4:5.3.13.eng: If I see a fault, I will make amends.’

pli-tv-kd4:5.3.15.eng: ‘I invite you to correct me concerning what you have seen, heard, or suspect.

pli-tv-kd4:5.5.1.eng: At one time on the invitation day, there were two monks staying in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd4:5.5.3.eng: “The Buddha has instructed that the invitation ceremony should be done in the Sangha when there are five monks and with one another when there are three or four.

pli-tv-kd4:5.5.4.eng: But there’s only two of us.

pli-tv-kd4:5.5.5.eng: So how should we do the invitation ceremony?”

pli-tv-kd4:5.5.7.eng: “When there are two of you, you should do the invitation ceremony with each other.

pli-tv-kd4:5.6.1.eng: And you should do it like this.

pli-tv-kd4:5.6.2.eng: The senior monk should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say to the junior monk:

pli-tv-kd4:5.6.3.pli: ‘ahaṃ, āvuso, āyasmantaṃ pavāremi diṭṭhena vā sutena vā parisaṅkāya vā.

pli-tv-kd4:5.7.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahu pavāraṇāya eko bhikkhu viharati.
pli-tv-kd4:5.7.1.eng: At one time on the invitation day, a monk was staying in a certain monastery by himself.

pli-tv-kd4:5.7.3.pli: “bhagavatā anuññātaṃ pañcannaṃ saṅghe pavāretuṃ, catunnaṃ aññamaññaṃ pavāretuṃ, tiṇṇaṃ aññamaññaṃ pavāretuṃ, dvinnaṃ aññamaññaṃ pavāretuṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:5.7.3.eng: “The Buddha has instructed that the invitation ceremony should be done in the Sangha when there are five monks and with one another when there are two, three, or four.

pli-tv-kd4:5.7.5.eng: So how should I do the invitation ceremony?”

pli-tv-kd4:5.8.1.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahu pavāraṇāya eko bhikkhu viharati.
pli-tv-kd4:5.8.1.eng: “On the invitation day, a monk may be staying by himself in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd4:5.8.2.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā yattha bhikkhū paṭikkamanti upaṭṭhānasālāya vā maṇḍape vā rukkhamūle vā, so deso sammajjitvā pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ upaṭṭhāpetvā āsanaṃ paññapetvā padīpaṃ katvā nisīditabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:5.8.2.eng: He should sweep the place where the monks normally go: whether the assembly hall, under a roof cover, or at the foot of a tree. He should set out water for drinking and water for washing. He should prepare a seat, light a lamp, and sit down.

pli-tv-kd4:5.8.3.pli: Sace aññe bhikkhū āgacchanti, tehi saddhiṃ pavāretabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd4:5.8.3.eng: If other monks arrive, he should do the invitation ceremony with them.

pli-tv-kd4:5.8.4.pli: no ce āgacchanti, ‘ajja me pavāraṇā’ti adhiṭṭhātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:5.8.4.eng: If not, he should determine: ‘Today is my invitation ceremony.’

pli-tv-kd4:5.8.5.eng: If he doesn’t make a determination, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd4:5.9.1.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yattha pañca bhikkhū viharanti, na ekassa pavāraṇaṃ āharitvā catūhi saṅghe pavāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:5.9.1.eng: Wherever five monks are staying together, four shouldn’t do the invitation ceremony in the Sangha, while the invitation of the fifth is brought.

pli-tv-kd4:5.9.2.eng: If you do the invitation in the Sangha, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd4:5.9.3.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yattha cattāro bhikkhū viharanti, na ekassa pavāraṇaṃ āharitvā tīhi aññamaññaṃ pavāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:5.9.3.eng: Wherever four monks are staying together, three shouldn’t do the invitation ceremony with one another, while the invitation of the fourth is brought.

pli-tv-kd4:5.9.4.eng: If you do the invitation in this way, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd4:5.9.5.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yattha tayo bhikkhū viharanti, na ekassa pavāraṇaṃ āharitvā dvīhi aññamaññaṃ pavāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:5.9.5.eng: Wherever three monks are staying together, two shouldn’t do the invitation ceremony with each other, while the invitation of the third is brought.

pli-tv-kd4:5.9.6.eng: If you do the invitation in this way, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd4:5.9.7.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yattha dve bhikkhū viharanti, na ekassa pavāraṇaṃ āharitvā ekena adhiṭṭhātabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:5.9.7.eng: Wherever two monks are staying together, one shouldn’t make a determination, while the invitation of the other is brought.

pli-tv-kd4:5.9.8.eng: If you do make a determination, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd4:6.1.0.eng: 6. The process for making amends for an offense

pli-tv-kd4:6.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu tadahu pavāraṇāya āpattiṃ āpanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd4:6.1.1.eng: At one time on the invitation day, a certain monk had committed an offense.

pli-tv-kd4:6.1.3.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd4:6.1.4.eng: that one shouldn’t invite correction if one has an unconfessed offense.

pli-tv-kd4:6.1.8.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tadahu pavāraṇāya āpattiṃ āpanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd4:6.1.8.eng: “On the invitation day, a monk may have committed an offense.

pli-tv-kd4:6.1.9.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā ekaṃ bhikkhuṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:6.1.9.eng: He should approach a single monk, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-kd4:6.1.10.pli: ‘ahaṃ, āvuso, itthannāmaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno, taṃ paṭidesemī’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:6.1.10.eng: ‘I’ve committed such-and-such an offense. I confess it.’

pli-tv-kd4:6.1.14.eng: ‘You should restrain yourself in the future.’

pli-tv-kd4:6.1.15.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tadahu pavāraṇāya āpattiyā vematiko hoti.
pli-tv-kd4:6.1.15.eng: On the invitation day, a monk may be unsure if he’s committed an offense.

pli-tv-kd4:6.1.16.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā ekaṃ bhikkhuṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:6.1.16.eng: He should approach a single monk, arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-kd4:6.1.17.eng: ‘I’m unsure if I’ve committed such-and-such an offense.

pli-tv-kd4:6.1.18.pli: yadā nibbematiko bhavissāmi tadā taṃ āpattiṃ paṭikarissāmī’ti vatvā pavāretabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd4:6.1.18.eng: I’ll make amends for it when I’m sure.’ They can then do the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:6.1.19.pli: na tveva tappaccayā pavāraṇāya antarāyo kātabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd4:6.1.19.eng: This is not an obstacle to doing the invitation ceremony.”

pli-tv-kd4:6.2.0.eng: 7. The process for revealing an offense

pli-tv-kd4:6.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu pavārayamāno āpattiṃ sarati.
pli-tv-kd4:6.2.1.eng: At one time a certain monk remembered an offense during the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:6.2.3.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd4:6.2.4.eng: that one shouldn’t invite correction if one has an unconfessed offense.

pli-tv-kd4:6.2.8.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pavārayamāno āpattiṃ sarati.
pli-tv-kd4:6.2.8.eng: “A monk may remember an offense during the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:6.2.9.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā sāmanto bhikkhu evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:6.2.9.eng: He should say to a monk sitting next to him,

pli-tv-kd4:6.2.11.pli: Ito vuṭṭhahitvā taṃ āpattiṃ paṭikarissāmī’ti vatvā pavāretabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd4:6.2.11.eng: Once this ceremony is finished, I’ll make amends for it.’ They can then continue the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:6.2.12.pli: na tveva tappaccayā pavāraṇāya antarāyo kātabbo.
pli-tv-kd4:6.2.12.eng: This is not an obstacle to doing the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pavārayamāno āpattiyā vematiko hoti.
pli-tv-kd4:6.3.1.eng: A monk may become unsure if he has committed an offense during the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.2.pli: Tena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā sāmanto bhikkhu evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:6.3.2.eng: He should say to a monk sitting next to him,

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.3.eng: ‘I’m unsure if I’ve committed such-and-such an offense.

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.4.pli: yadā nibbematiko bhavissāmi tadā taṃ āpattiṃ paṭikarissāmī’ti vatvā pavāretabbaṃ;
pli-tv-kd4:6.3.4.eng: I’ll make amends for it when I’m sure.’ They can then continue the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.5.pli: na tveva tappaccayā pavāraṇāya antarāyo kātabbo”ti.
pli-tv-kd4:6.3.5.eng: This is not an obstacle to doing the invitation ceremony.”

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.6.0.eng: 8. The process for making amends for a shared offense

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahu pavāraṇāya sabbo saṅgho sabhāgaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd4:6.3.6.1.eng: At one time on the invitation day, the whole Sangha in a certain monastery had committed the same offense.

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.8.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a rule

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.9.pli: ‘na sabhāgā āpatti desetabbā, na sabhāgā āpatti paṭiggahetabbā’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:6.3.9.eng: that one shouldn’t confess or receive the confession of shared offenses.

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.10.pli: Ayañca sabbo saṅgho sabhāgaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno.
pli-tv-kd4:6.3.10.eng: Yet here the whole Sangha has committed the same offense.

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.13.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahu pavāraṇāya sabbo saṅgho sabhāgaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd4:6.3.13.eng: “On the invitation day, the whole Sangha in a certain monastery may have committed the same offense.

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.14.pli: Tehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi eko bhikkhu sāmantā āvāsā sajjukaṃ pāhetabbo—
pli-tv-kd4:6.3.14.eng: Those monks should straightaway send a monk to a neighboring monastery:

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.16.eng: If he’s able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.17.pli: No ce labhetha, byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd4:6.3.17.eng: If he’s not, then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.18.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.19.pli: Ayaṃ sabbo saṅgho sabhāgaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno.
pli-tv-kd4:6.3.19.eng: This whole Sangha has committed the same offense.

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.20.pli: Yadā aññaṃ bhikkhuṃ suddhaṃ anāpattikaṃ passissati tadā tassa santike taṃ āpattiṃ paṭikarissatī’ti
pli-tv-kd4:6.3.20.eng: When the Sangha sees another monk who is pure and free of offenses, it should make amends for this offense with him.’

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.21.eng: Once this has been said, they can do the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.25.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.26.pli: Ayaṃ sabbo saṅgho sabhāgāya āpattiyā vematiko.
pli-tv-kd4:6.3.26.eng: This whole Sangha is unsure if it has committed the same offense.

pli-tv-kd4:6.3.27.pli: Yadā nibbematiko bhavissati tadā taṃ āpattiṃ paṭikarissatī’ti vatvā,

pli-tv-kd4:12.1.0.eng: 14. The successive series on entering a monastery zone

pli-tv-kd4:12.1.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahu pavāraṇāya sambahulā āvāsikā bhikkhū sannipatanti, pañca vā atirekā vā.
pli-tv-kd4:12.1.1.eng: “On the invitation day, five or more resident monks may have gathered together in a certain monastery.

pli-tv-kd4:12.1.3.eng: that other resident monks are entering the monastery zone. …

pli-tv-kd4:12.1.5.eng: that other resident monks have entered the monastery zone. …

pli-tv-kd4:12.1.7.eng: that other resident monks are entering the monastery zone. …

pli-tv-kd4:12.1.9.eng: that other resident monks have entered the monastery zone. …

pli-tv-kd4:12.1.10.pli: te na suṇanti ‘aññe āvāsikā bhikkhū antosīmaṃ okkamantī’ti …pe…
pli-tv-kd4:12.1.10.eng: They don’t hear that other resident monks are entering the monastery zone. …

pli-tv-kd4:12.1.11.pli: te na suṇanti ‘aññe āvāsikā bhikkhū antosīmaṃ okkantā’ti …pe….
pli-tv-kd4:12.1.11.eng: They don’t hear that other resident monks have entered the monastery zone. …”

pli-tv-kd4:12.1.12.pli: Āvāsikena āvāsikā ekasatapañcasattati tikanayato, āvāsikena āgantukā, āgantukena āvāsikā, āgantukena āgantukā, peyyālamukhena satta tikasatāni honti.
pli-tv-kd4:12.1.12.eng: As there are one hundred and seventy-five sets of three for resident monks with resident monks, so there is for newly-arrived monks with resident monks, resident monks with newly-arrived monks, newly-arrived monks with newly-arrived monks. Thus by way of succession, there are seven hundred sets of three.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, āvāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ cātuddaso hoti, āgantukānaṃ pannaraso.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.1.eng: “It may be, monks, that for the resident monks it’s the fourteenth day of the lunar half-month, but for the newly-arrived monks it’s the fifteenth. Then—

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.2.pli: Sace āvāsikā bahutarā honti, āgantukehi āvāsikānaṃ anuvattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.2.eng: If the number of resident monks is greater, the newly-arrived monks should fall in line with the resident monks.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.3.pli: Sace samasamā honti, āgantukehi āvāsikānaṃ anuvattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.3.eng: If the number is the same, the newly-arrived monks should fall in line with the resident monks.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.4.pli: Sace āgantukā bahutarā honti, āvāsikehi āgantukānaṃ anuvattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.4.eng: If the number of newly-arrived monks is greater, the resident monks should fall in line with the newly-arrived monks.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.5.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, āvāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pannaraso hoti, āgantukānaṃ cātuddaso.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.5.eng: It may be that for the resident monks it’s the fifteenth day of the lunar half-month, but for the newly-arrived monks it’s the fourteenth. Then—

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.6.pli: Sace āvāsikā bahutarā honti, āgantukehi āvāsikānaṃ anuvattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.6.eng: If the number of resident monks is greater, the newly-arrived monks should fall in line with the resident monks.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.7.pli: Sace samasamā honti, āgantukehi āvāsikānaṃ anuvattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.7.eng: If the number is the same, the newly-arrived monks should fall in line with the resident monks.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.8.pli: Sace āgantukā bahutarā honti, āvāsikehi āgantukānaṃ anuvattitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.8.eng: If the number of newly-arrived monks is greater, the resident monks should fall in line with the newly-arrived monks.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.9.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, āvāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭipado hoti, āgantukānaṃ pannaraso.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.9.eng: It may be that for the resident monks it’s the day after the invitation day, but for the newly-arrived monks it’s the fifteenth day of the lunar half-month. Then—

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.10.pli: Sace āvāsikā bahutarā honti, āvāsikehi āgantukānaṃ nākāmā dātabbā sāmaggī;
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.10.eng: If the number of resident monks is greater, the resident monks may, if they’re willing, do the invitation ceremony with the newly-arrived monks.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.11.eng: Otherwise the newly-arrived monks should go outside the monastery zone and do the invitation ceremony there.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.12.pli: Sace samasamā honti, āvāsikehi āgantukānaṃ nākāmā dātabbā sāmaggī;
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.12.eng: If the number is the same, the resident monks may, if they’re willing, do the invitation ceremony with the newly-arrived monks.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.13.eng: Otherwise the newly-arrived monks should go outside the monastery zone and do the invitation ceremony there.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.14.pli: Sace āgantukā bahutarā honti, āvāsikehi āgantukānaṃ sāmaggī vā dātabbā, nissīmaṃ vā gantabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.14.eng: If the number of newly-arrived monks is greater, the resident monks should do the invitation ceremony with the newly-arrived monks, or they should go outside the monastery zone while the newly-arrived monks do the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.15.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, āvāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pannaraso hoti, āgantukānaṃ pāṭipado.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.15.eng: It may be that for the resident monks it’s the fifteenth day of the lunar half-month, but for the newly-arrived monks it’s the day after the invitation day. Then—

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.16.pli: Sace āvāsikā bahutarā honti, āgantukehi āvāsikānaṃ sāmaggī vā dātabbā, nissīmaṃ vā gantabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.16.eng: If the number of resident monks is greater, the newly-arrived monks should do the invitation ceremony with the resident monks, or they should go outside the monastery zone while the resident monks do the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.17.pli: Sace samasamā honti, āgantukehi āvāsikānaṃ sāmaggī vā dātabbā, nissīmaṃ vā gantabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.17.eng: If the number is the same, the newly-arrived monks should do the invitation ceremony with the resident monks, or they should go outside the monastery zone while the resident monks do the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.18.pli: Sace āgantukā bahutarā honti, āgantukehi āvāsikānaṃ nākāmā dātabbā sāmaggī;
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.18.eng: If the number of newly-arrived monks is greater, they may, if they’re willing, do the invitation ceremony with the resident monks.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.19.eng: Otherwise the resident monks should go outside the monastery zone and do the invitation ceremony there.”

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.20.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, āgantukā bhikkhū passanti āvāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ āvāsikākāraṃ, āvāsikaliṅgaṃ, āvāsikanimittaṃ, āvāsikuddesaṃ, suppaññattaṃ mañcapīṭhaṃ bhisibibbohanaṃ, pānīyaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ sūpaṭṭhitaṃ, pariveṇaṃ susammaṭṭhaṃ;
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.20.1.eng: “It may happen that newly-arrived monks see signs and indications of resident monks: beds and benches that are made up, water for drinking and water for washing that are ready for use, yards that are well swept.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.21.pli: passitvā vematikā honti—‘atthi nu kho āvāsikā bhikkhū, natthi nu kho’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.21.eng: As a consequence, they’re unsure whether or not there are resident monks there. Then—

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.22.pli: Te vematikā na vicinanti, avicinitvā pavārenti. Āpatti dukkaṭassa …pe…
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.22.eng: If they do the invitation ceremony without investigating, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.22.comm: The Pali text has ellipsis points at the end of this sentence, but this seems to be a mistake, cf. Kd 2:34.6.3.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.23.pli: te vematikā vicinanti, vicinitvā na passanti, apassitvā pavārenti. Anāpatti.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.23.eng: If they investigate, but don’t see anyone, and then do the invitation ceremony, there’s no offense.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.24.pli: Te vematikā vicinanti, vicinitvā passanti, passitvā ekato pavārenti. Anāpatti.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.24.eng: If they investigate, and they see someone, and then do the invitation ceremony together, there’s no offense.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.25.pli: Te vematikā vicinanti, vicinitvā passanti, passitvā pāṭekkaṃ pavārenti. Āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.25.eng: If they investigate, and they see someone, but then do the invitation ceremony separately, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.26.pli: Te vematikā vicinanti, vicinitvā passanti, passitvā—‘nassantete, vinassantete, ko tehi attho’ti—bhedapurekkhārā pavārenti. Āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.26.eng: If they investigate, and they see someone, but think, ‘May they get lost! May they disappear! We are better off without them,’ and then do the invitation ceremony aiming at schism, there’s a serious offense.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.27.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, āgantukā bhikkhū suṇanti āvāsikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ āvāsikākāraṃ, āvāsikaliṅgaṃ, āvāsikanimittaṃ, āvāsikuddesaṃ, caṅkamantānaṃ padasaddaṃ, sajjhāyasaddaṃ, ukkāsitasaddaṃ, khipitasaddaṃ;
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.27.eng: It may happen that newly-arrived monks hear signs and indications of resident monks: the sound of the feet of someone doing walking meditation, the sound of recitation, the sound of coughing, the sound of sneezing.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.28.pli: sutvā vematikā honti—‘atthi nu kho āvāsikā bhikkhū, natthi nu kho’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.28.eng: As a consequence, they’re unsure whether or not there are resident monks there. Then—

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.29.pli: Te vematikā na vicinanti, avicinitvā pavārenti. Āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.29.eng: If they do the invitation ceremony without investigating, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.30.pli: Te vematikā vicinanti, vicinitvā na passanti, apassitvā pavārenti. Anāpatti.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.30.eng: If they investigate, but don’t see anyone, and then do the invitation ceremony, there’s no offense.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.48.0.eng: 17. The doing of the invitation ceremony with those belonging to a different Buddhist sect, etc.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.48.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, āgantukā bhikkhū passanti āvāsike bhikkhū nānāsaṃvāsake.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.48.1.eng: “It may happen that newly-arrived monks see resident monks who belong to a different Buddhist sect,
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.48.1.comm: Nānāsaṁvāsaka (and samānasaṁvāsaka) need to be carefully distinguished from nānāsaṁvāsa (and samānasaṁvāsa). Only the former means “one belonging to a different Buddhist sect”. The latter means “belonging to a different community”, as decided by sīmās.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.49.eng: but they have the view that they belong to the same one. Then—

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.50.pli: samānasaṃvāsakadiṭṭhiṃ paṭilabhitvā na pucchanti, apucchitvā ekato pavārenti, anāpatti.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.50.eng: If they don’t ask the resident monks about it, and then do the invitation ceremony together, there’s no offense.

pli-tv-kd4:13.1.51.pli: Te pucchanti, pucchitvā nābhivitaranti, anabhivitaritvā ekato pavārenti. Āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-kd4:13.1.51.eng: If they do ask the resident monks about it, but don’t reach a clear conclusion, and then do the invitation ceremony together, there’s an offense of wrong conduct.
