pli-tv-kd4:14.1.6.eng: one who has renounced the training,

pli-tv-kd4:14.1.7.eng: or one who has committed the worst kind of offense seated in the gathering.

pli-tv-kd4:14.1.8.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd4:14.2.1.pli: Na āpattiyā adassane ukkhittakassa nisinnaparisāya pavāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:14.2.1.eng: You shouldn’t do the invitation ceremony with one who has been ejected for not recognizing an offense seated in the gathering.

pli-tv-kd4:14.2.2.eng: If you do, you should be dealt with according to the rule.

pli-tv-kd4:14.2.3.eng: You shouldn’t do the invitation ceremony with one who has been ejected for not making amends for an offense seated in the gathering

pli-tv-kd4:14.2.4.pli: na pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā appaṭinissagge ukkhittakassa nisinnaparisāya pavāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:14.2.4.eng: or with one who has been ejected for not giving up a bad view seated in the gathering.

pli-tv-kd4:14.2.5.eng: If you do, you should be dealt with according to the rule.

pli-tv-kd4:14.3.1.eng: You shouldn’t do the invitation ceremony with a paṇḍaka seated in the gathering.

pli-tv-kd4:14.3.2.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd4:14.3.3.eng: You shouldn’t do the invitation ceremony with a fake monk,

pli-tv-kd4:14.3.4.eng: with one who has previously left to join the monastics of another religion,

pli-tv-kd4:14.3.8.eng: with a murderer of a perfected one,

pli-tv-kd4:14.3.9.eng: with one who has raped a nun,

pli-tv-kd4:14.3.10.eng: with one has caused a schism in the Sangha,

pli-tv-kd4:14.3.11.eng: with one who has caused the Buddha to bleed,

pli-tv-kd4:14.3.12.eng: or with a hermaphrodite seated in the gathering.

pli-tv-kd4:14.3.13.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd4:14.4.1.pli: Na, bhikkhave, pārivāsikapavāraṇādānena pavāretabbaṃ, aññatra avuṭṭhitāya parisāya.
pli-tv-kd4:14.4.1.eng: You shouldn’t do the invitation ceremony with a passed-on invitation that has expired, except if the gathering is still seated together.
pli-tv-kd4:14.4.1.comm: “A passed-on invitation that has expired”, pārivāsikapavāraṇādānena, seems to refer to an invitation that was conveyed for a different occasion. So long as the assembly is still seated, the occasion is regarded as the same. See the discussion to Bi Pc 81 in Appendix on Individual Bhikkhunī Rules in volume 3.

pli-tv-kd4:14.4.2.pli: Na ca, bhikkhave, appavāraṇāya pavāretabbaṃ, aññatra saṅghasāmaggiyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd4:14.4.2.eng: You shouldn’t do the invitation ceremony on a non-invitation day, except to unify the Sangha.”

pli-tv-kd4:14.4.3.eng: The second section for recitation is finished.

pli-tv-kd4:15.1.0.eng: 21. Invitation ceremonies by means of two statements

pli-tv-kd4:15.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena kosalesu janapade aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahu pavāraṇāya savarabhayaṃ ahosi.
pli-tv-kd4:15.1.1.eng: At one time on the invitation day in a certain monastery in the Kosalan country, there was a threat from primitive tribes.
pli-tv-kd4:15.1.1.comm: Sp 3.150: Savarabhayanti aṭavimanussabhayaṁ, “Savarabhayaṁ: threat from forest people.”

pli-tv-kd4:15.1.2.eng: The monks were unable to do the invitation ceremony by means of three statements.

pli-tv-kd4:15.1.4.eng: “I allow you to do the invitation ceremony by means of two statements.”

pli-tv-kd4:15.1.5.eng: The threat from primitive tribes increased.

pli-tv-kd4:15.1.6.eng: The monks were unable to do the invitation ceremony by means of two statements.

pli-tv-kd4:15.1.8.eng: “I allow you to do the invitation ceremony by means of one statement.”

pli-tv-kd4:15.1.9.eng: The threat from primitive tribes increased further.

pli-tv-kd4:15.1.10.eng: The monks were unable to do the invitation ceremony by means of one statement.

pli-tv-kd4:15.1.12.eng: “I allow you to do the invitation ceremony in groups according to the year of seniority.”

pli-tv-kd4:15.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahu pavāraṇāya manussehi dānaṃ dentehi yebhuyyena ratti khepitā hoti.
pli-tv-kd4:15.2.1.eng: On one occasion on the invitation day in a certain monastery, most of the night had been spent with people making offerings.

pli-tv-kd4:15.2.4.pli: Sace saṅgho tevācikaṃ pavāressati, appavāritova saṅgho bhavissati, athāyaṃ ratti vibhāyissati.
pli-tv-kd4:15.2.4.eng: and thought, “If the Sangha does the invitation ceremony by means of three statements, we won’t finish before dawn.

pli-tv-kd4:15.3.1.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahu pavāraṇāya manussehi dānaṃ dentehi yebhuyyena ratti khepitā hoti.

pli-tv-kd4:15.3.2.pli: Tatra ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ evaṃ hoti—

pli-tv-kd4:15.3.4.pli: Sace saṅgho tevācikaṃ pavāressati, appavāritova saṅgho bhavissati, athāyaṃ ratti vibhāyissatī’ti, byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd4:15.3.4.eng: a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd4:15.3.5.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd4:15.3.6.pli: Manussehi dānaṃ dentehi yebhuyyena ratti khepitā.
pli-tv-kd4:15.3.6.eng: Most of the night has been spent with people making offerings.

pli-tv-kd4:15.3.7.pli: Sace saṅgho tevācikaṃ pavāressati, appavāritova saṅgho bhavissati, athāyaṃ ratti vibhāyissati.
pli-tv-kd4:15.3.7.eng: If the Sangha does the invitation ceremony by means of three statements, we won’t finish before dawn.

pli-tv-kd4:15.3.8.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho dvevācikaṃ, ekavācikaṃ, samānavassikaṃ pavāreyyā’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:15.3.8.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should do the invitation ceremony by means of two statements.’ Or, ‘If the Sangha is ready, it should do the invitation ceremony by means of one statement.’ Or, ‘If the Sangha is ready, it should do the invitation ceremony in groups according to the year of seniority.’

pli-tv-kd4:15.4.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahu pavāraṇāya bhikkhūhi dhammaṃ bhaṇantehi …pe…
pli-tv-kd4:15.4.1.eng: It may happen on the invitation day that most of the night in a monastery is spent with monks giving teachings,

pli-tv-kd4:15.4.2.eng: with experts on the discourses reciting discourses,

pli-tv-kd4:15.4.3.eng: with experts on the Monastic Law discussing the Monastic Law,

pli-tv-kd4:15.4.4.eng: with expounders of the Teaching discussing the Teaching,

pli-tv-kd4:15.4.5.pli: bhikkhūhi kalahaṃ karontehi yebhuyyena ratti khepitā hoti.

pli-tv-kd4:15.4.8.pli: Sace saṅgho tevācikaṃ pavāressati, appavāritova saṅgho bhavissati, athāyaṃ ratti vibhāyissatī’ti, byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd4:15.4.8.eng: and think, ‘If the Sangha does the invitation ceremony by means of three statements, we won’t finish before dawn,’ then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd4:15.4.9.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd4:15.4.10.pli: Bhikkhūhi kalahaṃ karontehi yebhuyyena ratti khepitā.
pli-tv-kd4:15.4.10.eng: Most of the night has been spent with the monks arguing.

pli-tv-kd4:15.4.11.pli: Sace saṅgho tevācikaṃ pavāressati, appavāritova saṅgho bhavissati, athāyaṃ ratti vibhāyissati.
pli-tv-kd4:15.4.11.eng: If the Sangha does the invitation ceremony by means of three statements, we won’t finish before dawn.

pli-tv-kd4:15.4.12.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho dvevācikaṃ, ekavācikaṃ, samānavassikaṃ pavāreyyā’”ti.
pli-tv-kd4:15.4.12.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should do the invitation ceremony by means of two statements.’ Or, ‘If the Sangha is ready, it should do the invitation ceremony by means of one statement.’ Or, ‘If the Sangha is ready, it should do the invitation ceremony in groups according to the year of seniority.’”

pli-tv-kd4:15.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena kosalesu janapade aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahu pavāraṇāya mahābhikkhusaṅgho sannipatito hoti, parittañca anovassikaṃ hoti, mahā ca megho uggato hoti.
pli-tv-kd4:15.5.1.eng: At one time on the invitation day in a certain monastery in the Kosalan country, a large sangha of monks had gathered. Just then a storm was approaching, but they only had a small sheltered area.

pli-tv-kd4:15.5.3.pli: “ayaṃ kho mahābhikkhusaṅgho sannipatito, parittañca anovassikaṃ, mahā ca megho uggato.

pli-tv-kd4:15.5.4.pli: Sace saṅgho tevācikaṃ pavāressati, appavāritova saṅgho bhavissati, athāyaṃ megho pavassissati.
pli-tv-kd4:15.5.4.eng: and thought, “If the Sangha does the invitation ceremony by means of three statements, we won’t finish before it starts raining.

pli-tv-kd4:15.6.1.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahu pavāraṇāya mahābhikkhusaṅgho sannipatito hoti, parittañca anovassikaṃ hoti, mahā ca megho uggato hoti.

pli-tv-kd4:15.6.3.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho mahābhikkhusaṅgho sannipatito, parittañca anovassikaṃ, mahā ca megho uggato.

pli-tv-kd4:15.6.4.pli: Sace saṅgho tevācikaṃ pavāressati, appavāritova saṅgho bhavissati, athāyaṃ megho pavassissatī’ti.

pli-tv-kd4:15.6.5.eng: a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd4:15.6.6.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd4:15.6.7.pli: Ayaṃ mahābhikkhusaṅgho sannipatito, parittañca anovassikaṃ, mahā ca megho uggato.
pli-tv-kd4:15.6.7.eng: This large Sangha of monks has gathered. A storm is approaching, but we only have a small sheltered area.

pli-tv-kd4:15.6.8.pli: Sace saṅgho tevācikaṃ pavāressati, appavāritova saṅgho bhavissati, athāyaṃ megho pavassissati.
pli-tv-kd4:15.6.8.eng: If the Sangha does the invitation ceremony by means of three statements, we won’t finish before it starts raining.

pli-tv-kd4:15.6.9.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho dvevācikaṃ, ekavācikaṃ, samānavassikaṃ pavāreyyā’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:15.6.9.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should do the invitation ceremony by means of two statements.’ Or, ‘If the Sangha is ready, it should do the invitation ceremony by means of one statement.’ Or, ‘If the Sangha is ready, it should do the invitation ceremony in groups according to the year of seniority.’

pli-tv-kd4:15.7.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, aññatarasmiṃ āvāse tadahu pavāraṇāya rājantarāyo hoti …pe…
pli-tv-kd4:15.7.1.eng: It may happen on the invitation day in a certain monastery that there is a threat from kings,

pli-tv-kd4:15.7.10.eng: or a threat to the monastic life.

pli-tv-kd4:15.7.13.pli: Sace saṅgho tevācikaṃ pavāressati, appavāritova saṅgho bhavissati, athāyaṃ brahmacariyantarāyo bhavissatī’ti, byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd4:15.7.13.eng: and think, ‘This is a threat to the monastic life. If the Sangha does the invitation ceremony by means of three statements, we won’t finish before the threat manifests,’ then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd4:15.7.14.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd4:15.7.15.eng: This is a threat to the monastic life.

pli-tv-kd4:15.7.16.pli: Sace saṅgho tevācikaṃ pavāressati, appavāritova saṅgho bhavissati, athāyaṃ brahmacariyantarāyo bhavissati.
pli-tv-kd4:15.7.16.eng: If the Sangha does the invitation ceremony by means of three statements, we won’t finish before the threat manifests.

pli-tv-kd4:15.7.17.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho dvevācikaṃ, ekavācikaṃ, samānavassikaṃ pavāreyyā’”ti.
pli-tv-kd4:15.7.17.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should do the invitation ceremony by means of two statements.’ Or, ‘If the Sangha is ready, it should do the invitation ceremony by means of one statement.’ Or, ‘If the Sangha is ready, it should do the invitation ceremony in groups according to the year of seniority.’”

pli-tv-kd4:16.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sāpattikā pavārenti.
pli-tv-kd4:16.1.1.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six invited correction while having unconfessed offenses.

pli-tv-kd4:16.1.3.eng: “You shouldn’t invite correction if you have unconfessed offenses.

pli-tv-kd4:16.1.4.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd4:16.1.5.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, yo sāpattiko pavāreti, tassa okāsaṃ kārāpetvā āpattiyā codetun”ti.
pli-tv-kd4:16.1.5.eng: If anyone invites correction with an unconfessed offense, you should get their permission and then accuse them of an offense.”

pli-tv-kd4:16.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū okāsaṃ kārāpiyamānā na icchanti okāsaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:16.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards, when asked for permission, the monks from the group of six refused to give it.

pli-tv-kd4:16.2.3.eng: “If anyone doesn’t give their permission, you should cancel their invitation.

pli-tv-kd4:16.2.4.eng: And it should be done like this.

pli-tv-kd4:16.2.5.pli: Tadahu pavāraṇāya cātuddase vā pannarase vā tasmiṃ puggale sammukhībhūte saṅghamajjhe udāharitabbaṃ—
pli-tv-kd4:16.2.5.eng: On the invitation day, whether the fourteenth or the fifteenth, in the midst of the Sangha and in the presence of that person, you should announce:

pli-tv-kd4:16.2.6.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd4:16.2.7.eng: Such-and-such a person has an unconfessed offense.

pli-tv-kd4:16.2.8.comm: I use a gender neutral expression since monks are also allowed to cancel the invitation of nuns.

pli-tv-kd4:16.2.9.eng: The invitation ceremony shouldn’t be done in their presence.’

pli-tv-kd4:16.2.10.eng: Their invitation has then been canceled.”

pli-tv-kd4:16.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū—
pli-tv-kd4:16.3.1.eng: On one occasion the monks from the group of six—

pli-tv-kd4:16.3.2.eng: thinking to act before the good monks canceled their invitation,

pli-tv-kd4:16.3.3.pli: paṭikacceva suddhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ anāpattikānaṃ avatthusmiṃ akāraṇe pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapenti, pavāritānampi pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapenti.
pli-tv-kd4:16.3.3.eng: but having no reason for doing so—canceled the invitation of pure monks who had not committed any offenses. They also canceled the invitation of those who already had invited.

pli-tv-kd4:16.3.5.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, suddhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ anāpattikānaṃ avatthusmiṃ akāraṇe pavāraṇā ṭhapetabbā.
pli-tv-kd4:16.3.5.eng: “When there is no reason for doing so, you shouldn’t cancel the invitation of pure monks who haven’t committed any offenses.

pli-tv-kd4:16.3.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd4:16.3.7.eng: And you shouldn’t cancel the invitation of those who already have invited.

pli-tv-kd4:16.3.8.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd4:16.4.1.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, ṭhapitā hoti pavāraṇā, evaṃ aṭṭhapitā.
pli-tv-kd4:16.4.1.eng: And this is how the invitation is canceled and how it isn’t canceled.

pli-tv-kd4:16.4.3.pli: Tevācikāya ce, bhikkhave, pavāraṇāya bhāsitāya lapitāya pariyositāya pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, aṭṭhapitā hoti pavāraṇā.
pli-tv-kd4:16.4.3.eng: If the invitation is canceled after a three-statement invitation has been spoken and concluded, then it isn’t canceled.

pli-tv-kd4:16.4.4.eng: If the invitation is canceled after a two-statement invitation …

pli-tv-kd4:16.4.6.pli: samānavassikāya ce, bhikkhave, pavāraṇāya bhāsitāya lapitāya pariyositāya pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, aṭṭhapitā hoti pavāraṇā.
pli-tv-kd4:16.4.6.eng: after an invitation done in groups according to the year of seniority has been spoken and concluded, then it isn’t canceled.

pli-tv-kd4:16.4.7.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭhapitā hoti pavāraṇā.

pli-tv-kd4:16.5.1.pli: Tevācikāya ce, bhikkhave, pavāraṇāya bhāsitāya lapitāya apariyositāya pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, ṭhapitā hoti pavāraṇā.
pli-tv-kd4:16.5.1.eng: If the invitation is canceled when a three-statement invitation hasn’t yet been concluded, then it’s canceled.

pli-tv-kd4:16.5.2.eng: If the invitation is canceled when a two-statement invitation …

pli-tv-kd4:16.5.4.pli: samānavassikāya ce, bhikkhave, pavāraṇāya bhāsitāya lapitāya apariyositāya pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, ṭhapitā hoti pavāraṇā.
pli-tv-kd4:16.5.4.eng: when an invitation done in groups according to the year of seniority hasn’t yet been concluded, then it’s canceled.

pli-tv-kd4:16.5.5.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, ṭhapitā hoti pavāraṇā.

pli-tv-kd4:16.6.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, tadahu pavāraṇāya bhikkhu bhikkhussa pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti.
pli-tv-kd4:16.6.1.eng: It may happen on the invitation day that a monk cancels a second monk’s invitation.

pli-tv-kd4:16.6.2.eng: If other monks know about the first monk:

pli-tv-kd4:16.6.3.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho āyasmā aparisuddhakāyasamācāro, aparisuddhavacīsamācāro, aparisuddhājīvo, bālo, abyatto, na paṭibalo anuyuñjīyamāno anuyogaṃ dātun’ti, ‘alaṃ, bhikkhu, mā bhaṇḍanaṃ, mā kalahaṃ, mā viggahaṃ, mā vivādan’ti omadditvā saṅghena pavāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:16.6.3.eng: ‘This venerable is impure in bodily conduct, verbal conduct, and livelihood; he’s ignorant and incompetent, incapable of answering properly when questioned,’ then they should press him by saying, ‘Enough. No more arguing and disputing,’ and the Sangha should then do the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:16.7.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, tadahu pavāraṇāya bhikkhu bhikkhussa pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti.
pli-tv-kd4:16.7.1.eng: It may happen on the invitation day that a monk cancels a second monk’s invitation.

pli-tv-kd4:16.7.2.eng: If other monks know about the first monk:

pli-tv-kd4:16.7.3.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho āyasmā parisuddhakāyasamācāro, aparisuddhavacīsamācāro, aparisuddhājīvo, bālo, abyatto, na paṭibalo anuyuñjīyamāno anuyogaṃ dātun’ti, ‘alaṃ, bhikkhu, mā bhaṇḍanaṃ, mā kalahaṃ, mā viggahaṃ, mā vivādan’ti omadditvā saṅghena pavāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:16.7.3.eng: ‘This venerable is pure in bodily conduct, but impure in verbal conduct and livelihood; he’s ignorant and incompetent, incapable of answering properly when questioned,’ then they should press him by saying, ‘Enough. No more arguing and disputing,’ and the Sangha should then do the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:16.8.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, tadahu pavāraṇāya bhikkhu bhikkhussa pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti.
pli-tv-kd4:16.8.1.eng: It may happen on the invitation day that a monk cancels a second monk’s invitation.

pli-tv-kd4:16.8.2.eng: If other monks know about the first monk:

pli-tv-kd4:16.8.3.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho āyasmā parisuddhakāyasamācāro, parisuddhavacīsamācāro, aparisuddhājīvo, bālo, abyatto, na paṭibalo anuyuñjīyamāno anuyogaṃ dātun’ti, ‘alaṃ, bhikkhu, mā bhaṇḍanaṃ, mā kalahaṃ, mā viggahaṃ, mā vivādan’ti omadditvā saṅghena pavāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:16.8.3.eng: ‘This venerable is pure in bodily conduct and verbal conduct, but impure in livelihood; he’s ignorant and incompetent, incapable of answering properly when questioned,’ then they should press him by saying, ‘Enough. No more arguing and disputing,’ and the Sangha should then do the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:16.9.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, tadahu pavāraṇāya bhikkhu bhikkhussa pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti.
pli-tv-kd4:16.9.1.eng: It may happen on the invitation day that a monk cancels a second monk’s invitation.

pli-tv-kd4:16.9.2.eng: If other monks know about the first monk:

pli-tv-kd4:16.9.3.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho āyasmā parisuddhakāyasamācāro, parisuddhavacīsamācāro, parisuddhājīvo, bālo, abyatto, na paṭibalo anuyuñjīyamāno anuyogaṃ dātun’ti, ‘alaṃ, bhikkhu, mā bhaṇḍanaṃ, mā kalahaṃ, mā viggahaṃ, mā vivādan’ti omadditvā saṅghena pavāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:16.9.3.eng: ‘This venerable is pure in bodily conduct, verbal conduct, and livelihood; but he’s ignorant and incompetent, incapable of answering properly when questioned,’ then they should press him by saying, ‘Enough. No more arguing and disputing,’ and the Sangha should then do the invitation ceremony.”

pli-tv-kd4:16.10.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, tadahu pavāraṇāya bhikkhu bhikkhussa pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti.
pli-tv-kd4:16.10.1.eng: “It may happen on the invitation day that a monk cancels a second monk’s invitation.

pli-tv-kd4:16.10.2.eng: If other monks know about the first monk:

pli-tv-kd4:16.10.3.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho āyasmā parisuddhakāyasamācāro, parisuddhavacīsamācāro, parisuddhājīvo, paṇḍito, byatto, paṭibalo anuyuñjīyamāno anuyogaṃ dātun’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo, ‘yaṃ kho tvaṃ, āvuso, imassa bhikkhuno pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapesi, kimhi naṃ ṭhapesi, sīlavipattiyā vā ṭhapesi, ācāravipattiyā vā ṭhapesi, diṭṭhivipattiyā vā ṭhapesī’ti?
pli-tv-kd4:16.10.3.eng: ‘This venerable is pure in bodily conduct, verbal conduct, and livelihood; he’s knowledgeable and competent, capable of answering properly when questioned,’ then they should say to him, ‘Are you canceling this monk’s invitation because he has failed in morality, in conduct, or in view?’

pli-tv-kd4:16.11.2.pli: ‘sīlavipattiyā vā ṭhapemi, ācāravipattiyā vā ṭhapemi, diṭṭhivipattiyā vā ṭhapemī’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:16.11.2.eng: ‘I’m canceling it because he has failed in morality,’ ‘I’m canceling it because he has failed in conduct,’ or ‘I’m canceling it because he has failed in view,’ he should be asked,

pli-tv-kd4:16.11.3.pli: ‘jānāsi panāyasmā sīlavipattiṃ, jānāsi ācāravipattiṃ, jānāsi diṭṭhivipattin’ti?
pli-tv-kd4:16.11.3.eng: ‘Do you know what failure in morality is?’ ‘Do you know what failure in conduct is?’ or ‘Do you know what failure in view is?’

pli-tv-kd4:16.11.5.pli: ‘jānāmi kho ahaṃ, āvuso, sīlavipattiṃ, jānāmi ācāravipattiṃ, jānāmi diṭṭhivipattin’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:16.11.5.eng: ‘I do,’ he should be asked what they are.

pli-tv-kd4:16.11.6.pli: ‘katamā panāvuso, sīlavipatti, katamā ācāravipatti, katamā diṭṭhivipattī’ti?

pli-tv-kd4:16.12.2.eng: ‘The four offenses entailing expulsion and the thirteen entailing suspension are failure in morality,’

pli-tv-kd4:16.12.3.pli: thullaccayaṃ, pācittiyaṃ, pāṭidesanīyaṃ, dukkaṭaṃ, dubbhāsitaṃ, ayaṃ ācāravipatti;
pli-tv-kd4:16.12.3.eng: ‘The serious offenses, the offenses entailing confession, the offenses entailing acknowledgment, the offenses of wrong conduct, and the offenses of wrong speech are failure in conduct,’

pli-tv-kd4:16.12.4.pli: micchādiṭṭhi, antaggāhikādiṭṭhi, ayaṃ diṭṭhivipattī’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:16.12.4.eng: ‘Wrong views and extreme views are failure in view,’ he should be asked,

pli-tv-kd4:16.12.5.pli: ‘yaṃ kho tvaṃ, āvuso, imassa bhikkhuno pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapesi, diṭṭhena vā ṭhapesi, sutena vā ṭhapesi, parisaṅkāya vā ṭhapesī’ti?
pli-tv-kd4:16.12.5.eng: ‘Are you canceling this monk’s invitation because of what you’ve seen, what you’ve heard, or what you suspect?’

pli-tv-kd4:16.13.2.pli: ‘diṭṭhena vā ṭhapemi, sutena vā ṭhapemi, parisaṅkāya vā ṭhapemī’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:16.13.2.eng: ‘I’m canceling it because of what I’ve seen,’ ‘I’m canceling it because of what I’ve heard,’ or ‘I’m canceling it because of what I suspect,’ he should be asked,

pli-tv-kd4:16.13.3.pli: ‘yaṃ kho tvaṃ, āvuso, imassa bhikkhuno diṭṭhena pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapesi, kiṃ te diṭṭhaṃ, kinti te diṭṭhaṃ, kadā te diṭṭhaṃ, kattha te diṭṭhaṃ, pārājikaṃ ajjhāpajjanto diṭṭho, saṅghādisesaṃ ajjhāpajjanto diṭṭho,
pli-tv-kd4:16.13.3.eng: ‘Since you’re canceling this monk’s invitation because of what you’ve seen, what have you seen? How did you see it? When did you see it? Where did you see it? Did you see him commit an offense entailing expulsion, an offense entailing suspension,

pli-tv-kd4:16.13.8.pli: dubbhāsitaṃ ajjhāpajjanto diṭṭho, kattha ca tvaṃ ahosi, kattha cāyaṃ bhikkhu ahosi, kiñca tvaṃ karosi, kiñcāyaṃ bhikkhu karotī’ti?
pli-tv-kd4:16.13.8.eng: or an offense of wrong speech? Where were you? Where was this monk? What were you doing? What was this monk doing?’

pli-tv-kd4:16.14.2.pli: ‘na kho ahaṃ, āvuso, imassa bhikkhuno diṭṭhena pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapemi, api ca sutena pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapemī’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:16.14.2.eng: ‘I didn’t cancel this monk’s invitation because of what I’ve seen, but because of what I’ve heard,’ he should be asked,

pli-tv-kd4:16.14.3.pli: ‘yaṃ kho tvaṃ, āvuso, imassa bhikkhuno sutena pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapesi, kiṃ te sutaṃ, kinti te sutaṃ, kadā te sutaṃ, kattha te sutaṃ,
pli-tv-kd4:16.14.3.eng: ‘Since you’re canceling this monk’s invitation because of what you’ve heard, what have you heard? How did you hear it? When did you hear it? Where did you hear it?

pli-tv-kd4:16.14.4.pli: pārājikaṃ ajjhāpannoti sutaṃ, saṅghādisesaṃ ajjhāpannoti sutaṃ, thullaccayaṃ …pācittiyaṃ … pāṭidesanīyaṃ … dukkaṭaṃ … dubbhāsitaṃ ajjhāpannoti sutaṃ,
pli-tv-kd4:16.14.4.eng: Did you hear that he has committed an offense entailing expulsion, an offense entailing suspension, a serious offense, an offense entailing confession, an offense entailing acknowledgment, an offense of wrong conduct, or an offense of wrong speech?

pli-tv-kd4:16.14.5.pli: bhikkhussa sutaṃ, bhikkhuniyā sutaṃ, sikkhamānāya sutaṃ, sāmaṇerassa sutaṃ, sāmaṇeriyā sutaṃ, upāsakassa sutaṃ, upāsikāya sutaṃ, rājūnaṃ sutaṃ, rājamahāmattānaṃ sutaṃ, titthiyānaṃ sutaṃ, titthiyasāvakānaṃ sutan’ti?
pli-tv-kd4:16.14.5.eng: Did you hear it from a monk, a nun, a trainee nun, a novice monk, a novice nun, a male lay follower, or a female lay follower? Or did you hear it from kings, a king’s officials, the monastics of another religion, or the lay followers of another religion?’

pli-tv-kd4:16.15.1.pli: So ce evaṃ vadeyya—‘na kho ahaṃ, āvuso, imassa bhikkhuno sutena pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapemi, api ca parisaṅkāya pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapemī’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:16.15.1.eng: If he says, ‘I didn’t cancel this monk’s invitation because of what I’ve heard, but because of what I suspect,’ he should be asked,

pli-tv-kd4:16.15.2.pli: ‘yaṃ kho tvaṃ, āvuso, imassa bhikkhuno parisaṅkāya pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapesi, kiṃ parisaṅkasi, kinti parisaṅkasi, kadā parisaṅkasi, kattha parisaṅkasi,
pli-tv-kd4:16.15.2.eng: ‘Since you’re canceling this monk’s invitation because of suspicion, what do you suspect? How do you suspect it? When did you suspect it? Where did you suspect it?

pli-tv-kd4:16.15.3.pli: pārājikaṃ ajjhāpannoti parisaṅkasi, saṅghādisesaṃ ajjhāpannoti parisaṅkasi, thullaccayaṃ … pācittiyaṃ … pāṭidesanīyaṃ … dukkaṭaṃ … dubbhāsitaṃ ajjhāpannoti parisaṅkasi,
pli-tv-kd4:16.15.3.eng: Do you suspect that he has committed an offense entailing expulsion, an offense entailing suspension, a serious offense, an offense entailing confession, an offense entailing acknowledgment, an offense of wrong conduct, or an offense of wrong speech?

pli-tv-kd4:16.15.4.pli: bhikkhussa sutvā parisaṅkasi, bhikkhuniyā sutvā parisaṅkasi, sikkhamānāya sutvā parisaṅkasi, sāmaṇerassa sutvā parisaṅkasi, sāmaṇeriyā sutvā parisaṅkasi, upāsakassa sutvā parisaṅkasi, upāsikāya sutvā parisaṅkasi, rājūnaṃ sutvā parisaṅkasi, rājamahāmattānaṃ sutvā parisaṅkasi, titthiyānaṃ sutvā parisaṅkasi, titthiyasāvakānaṃ sutvā parisaṅkasī’ti?
pli-tv-kd4:16.15.4.eng: Do you suspect it after hearing about it from a monk, a nun, a trainee nun, a novice monk, a novice nun, a male lay follower, or a female lay follower? Or do you suspect it after hearing about it from kings, a king’s officials, the monastics of another religion, or the lay followers of another religion?’

pli-tv-kd4:16.16.1.comm: Ce, “if”, does not fit in the current context, since there is no main clause corresponding to the conditional clause. Perhaps this is an ancient mistake, whereby the ce has been added on the pattern of the similar phrases above. I translate as if the ce is not there.

pli-tv-kd4:16.16.2.pli: ‘na kho ahaṃ, āvuso, imassa bhikkhuno parisaṅkāya pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapemi, api ca ahampi na jānāmi kena panāhaṃ imassa bhikkhuno pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapemī’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:16.16.2.eng: ‘I didn’t cancel this monk’s invitation because of what I suspect. I don’t know why I canceled his invitation.’

pli-tv-kd4:16.16.3.pli: So ce, bhikkhave, codako bhikkhu anuyogena viññūnaṃ sabrahmacārīnaṃ cittaṃ na ārādheti, ananuvādo cudito bhikkhūti alaṃvacanāya.
pli-tv-kd4:16.16.3.eng: If the accusing monk, when questioned, isn’t able to satisfy his discerning fellow monastics, they should conclude, ‘The accused monk is improperly accused.’

pli-tv-kd4:16.16.4.pli: So ce, bhikkhave, codako bhikkhu anuyogena viññūnaṃ sabrahmacārīnaṃ cittaṃ ārādheti, sānuvādo cudito bhikkhūti alaṃvacanāya.
pli-tv-kd4:16.16.4.eng: But if the accusing monk, when questioned, is able to satisfy his discerning fellow monastics, they should conclude, ‘The accused monk is properly accused.’
pli-tv-kd4:16.16.4.comm: Vin-vn-ṭ 2777: Sānuvādoti ettha anuvādo nāma codanā, saha anuvādena vattatīti sānuvādo, “Sānuvādo: here accusing is called anuvādo. Sānuvādo means he proceeds with an accusation.”

pli-tv-kd4:16.17.1.pli: So ce, bhikkhave, codako bhikkhu amūlakena pārājikena anuddhaṃsitaṃ paṭijānāti, saṅghādisesaṃ āropetvā saṅghena pavāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:16.17.1.eng: If the accusing monk admits to a groundless charge of an offense entailing expulsion, he should be charged with an offense entailing suspension. The Sangha should then do the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:16.17.2.pli: So ce, bhikkhave, codako bhikkhu amūlakena saṅghādisesena anuddhaṃsitaṃ paṭijānāti, yathādhammaṃ kārāpetvā saṅghena pavāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:16.17.2.eng: If the accusing monk admits to a groundless charge of an offense entailing suspension, he should be dealt with according to the rule. The Sangha should then do the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:16.17.3.pli: So ce, bhikkhave, codako, bhikkhu amūlakena thullaccayena …
pli-tv-kd4:16.17.3.eng: If the accusing monk admits to a groundless charge of a serious offense,

pli-tv-kd4:16.17.7.pli: dubbhāsitena anuddhaṃsitaṃ paṭijānāti, yathādhammaṃ kārāpetvā saṅghena pavāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:16.17.7.eng: or an offense of wrong speech, he should be dealt with according to the rule. The Sangha should then do the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:16.18.1.pli: So ce, bhikkhave, cudito bhikkhu pārājikaṃ ajjhāpannoti paṭijānāti, nāsetvā saṅghena pavāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:16.18.1.eng: If the accused monk admits to having committed an offense entailing expulsion, he should be expelled. The Sangha should then do the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:16.18.2.pli: So ce, bhikkhave, cudito bhikkhu saṅghādisesaṃ ajjhāpannoti paṭijānāti, saṅghādisesaṃ āropetvā saṅghena pavāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:16.18.2.eng: If the accused monk admits to having committed an offense entailing suspension, he should be charged with that offense. The Sangha should then do the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:16.18.3.pli: So ce, bhikkhave, cudito bhikkhu thullaccayaṃ …
pli-tv-kd4:16.18.3.eng: If the accused monk admits to having committed a serious offense,

pli-tv-kd4:16.18.7.pli: dubbhāsitaṃ ajjhāpannoti paṭijānāti, yathādhammaṃ kārāpetvā saṅghena pavāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:16.18.7.eng: or an offense of wrong speech, he should be dealt with according to the rule. The Sangha should then do the invitation ceremony.”

pli-tv-kd4:16.19.0.eng: 23. Grounds for a serious offense, etc.

pli-tv-kd4:16.19.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tadahu pavāraṇāya thullaccayaṃ ajjhāpanno hoti.
pli-tv-kd4:16.19.1.eng: “On the invitation day, a monk may have committed a serious offense.

pli-tv-kd4:16.19.2.pli: Ekacce bhikkhū thullaccayadiṭṭhino honti, ekacce bhikkhū saṅghādisesadiṭṭhino honti.
pli-tv-kd4:16.19.2.eng: Some monks regard it as a serious offense, but others as an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-kd4:16.19.3.pli: Ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū thullaccayadiṭṭhino, tehi so, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ekamantaṃ apanetvā yathādhammaṃ kārāpetvā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:16.19.3.eng: The monks who regard it as a serious offense should take that monk aside and deal with him according to the rule. They should then approach the Sangha and say:

pli-tv-kd4:16.19.4.pli: ‘yaṃ kho so, āvuso, bhikkhu āpattiṃ āpanno, sāssa yathādhammaṃ paṭikatā.
pli-tv-kd4:16.19.4.eng: ‘This monk has made amends for the offense he has committed.

pli-tv-kd4:16.19.5.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should do the invitation ceremony.’

pli-tv-kd4:16.23.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tadahu pavāraṇāya saṅghamajjhe udāhareyya—
pli-tv-kd4:16.23.1.eng: “It may happen on the invitation day that a monk announces in the midst of the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd4:16.23.2.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd4:16.23.3.eng: I know about an offense, but not who the offender is.
pli-tv-kd4:16.23.3.comm: Sp 3.239: Idaṁ vatthu paññāyati na puggaloti ettha corā kira araññavihāre pokkharaṇito macche gahetvā pacitvā khāditvā agamaṁsu. So taṁ vippakāraṁ disvā ārāme vā kiñci dhuttena kataṁ vippakāraṁ disvā “bhikkhussa iminā kammena bhavitabban”ti sallakkhetvā evamāha, “I know about an offense, but not who the offender is: here, criminals catch fish from a pond near a forest monastery. They then cook it, eat it, and leave. Having seen the disturbance or having seen whatever disturbance was done by the scoundrels in the monastery, having reflected, ‘This action may have been done by a monk,’ he says thus.”

pli-tv-kd4:16.23.4.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, vatthuṃ ṭhapetvā saṅgho pavāreyyā’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:16.23.4.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should set aside the offense and then do the invitation ceremony.’
pli-tv-kd4:16.23.4.comm: Sp 3.239: Vatthuṁ ṭhapetvā saṅgho pavāreyyāti “yadā taṁ puggalaṁ jānissāma, tadā naṁ codessāma. Idāni pana saṅgho pavāretū”ti ayamettha attho, “Vatthuṁ ṭhapetvā saṅgho pavāreyya: this is the meaning here: when we discover that person, we will accuse him. But now the Sangha should do the invitation ceremony.”

pli-tv-kd4:16.23.6.eng: ‘The Buddha has laid down a rule that the invitation ceremony is for monks who are pure.

pli-tv-kd4:16.23.7.pli: Sace vatthu paññāyati, na puggalo, idāneva naṃ vadehī’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:16.23.7.eng: If you know the offense, but not the offender, then say now who it is that you suspect.’
pli-tv-kd4:16.23.7.comm: Sp 3.239: Idāneva naṁ vadehīti sace iminā vatthunā kañci puggalaṁ parisaṅkasi, idāneva naṁ apadisāhīti attho, “Idāneva naṁ vadehi: the meaning is: if you suspect someone to have committed this offense, then indicate who it is now.”

pli-tv-kd4:16.24.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tadahu pavāraṇāya saṅghamajjhe udāhareyya—
pli-tv-kd4:16.24.1.eng: It may happen on the invitation day that a monk announces in the midst of the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd4:16.24.2.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd4:16.24.3.eng: I know of an offender, but not what the offense is.

pli-tv-kd4:16.24.4.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, puggalaṃ ṭhapetvā saṅgho pavāreyyā’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:16.24.4.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should do the invitation ceremony without the offender.’

pli-tv-kd4:16.24.6.eng: ‘The Buddha has laid down a rule that the invitation ceremony should be done in a complete assembly.

pli-tv-kd4:16.24.7.pli: Sace puggalo paññāyati, na vatthu, idāneva naṃ vadehī’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:16.24.7.eng: If you know the offender, but not the offense, then say now what it is that you suspect.’
pli-tv-kd4:16.24.7.comm: Sp 3.239: Idāneva naṁ vadehīti yaṁ tvaṁ puggalaṁ ṭhapesi, tassa puggalassa idāneva dosaṁ vada, “Idāneva naṁ vadehi: say now the fault of the person of whom you are canceling the invitation.”

pli-tv-kd4:16.25.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tadahu pavāraṇāya saṅghamajjhe udāhareyya—
pli-tv-kd4:16.25.1.eng: It may happen on the invitation day that a monk announces in the midst of the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd4:16.25.2.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd4:16.25.3.pli: Idaṃ vatthu ca puggalo ca paññāyati.
pli-tv-kd4:16.25.3.eng: I know of an offender and his offense.

pli-tv-kd4:16.25.4.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, vatthuñca puggalañca ṭhapetvā saṅgho pavāreyyā’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:16.25.4.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should set aside the offense and then do the invitation ceremony without the offender.’

pli-tv-kd4:16.25.6.pli: ‘bhagavatā kho, āvuso, visuddhānañca samaggānañca pavāraṇā paññattā.
pli-tv-kd4:16.25.6.eng: ‘The Buddha has laid down a rule that the invitation ceremony should be done in a complete assembly by monks who are pure.

pli-tv-kd4:16.25.7.pli: Sace vatthu ca puggalo ca paññāyati, idāneva naṃ vadehī’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:16.25.7.eng: If you know an offender and his offense, then say now what they are.’

pli-tv-kd4:16.26.1.pli: Pubbe ce, bhikkhave, pavāraṇāya vatthu paññāyati, pacchā puggalo, kallaṃ vacanāya.
pli-tv-kd4:16.26.1.eng: If the offense is known about before the invitation ceremony, but the offender only afterwards, the offender should be corrected.

pli-tv-kd4:16.26.2.pli: Pubbe ce, bhikkhave, pavāraṇāya puggalo paññāyati, pacchā vatthu, kallaṃ vacanāya.
pli-tv-kd4:16.26.2.eng: If the offender is known about before the invitation ceremony, but the offense only afterwards, the offender should be corrected.

pli-tv-kd4:16.26.3.pli: Pubbe ce, bhikkhave, pavāraṇāya vatthu ca puggalo ca paññāyati, tañce katāya pavāraṇāya ukkoṭeti, ukkoṭanakaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd4:16.26.3.eng: If both the offense and the offender are known about before the invitation ceremony, and someone reopens the case after the invitation ceremony has been done, he commits an offense entailing confession for the reopening.”

pli-tv-kd4:17.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā sandiṭṭhā sambhattā bhikkhū kosalesu janapade aññatarasmiṃ āvāse vassaṃ upagacchiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd4:17.1.1.eng: At one time in a certain monastery in the Kosalan country, a number of monks who were friends had entered the rainy-season residence together.

pli-tv-kd4:17.1.2.pli: Tesaṃ sāmantā aññe bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā vassaṃ upagacchiṃsu—
pli-tv-kd4:17.1.2.eng: Other monks who were quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha had entered the rains residence nearby. They said to one another,

pli-tv-kd4:17.1.3.pli: “mayaṃ tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ vassaṃvuṭṭhānaṃ pavāraṇāya pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapessāmā”ti.
pli-tv-kd4:17.1.3.eng: “At the invitation ceremony, when those monks have completed the rains residence, we’ll cancel their invitation.”

pli-tv-kd4:17.1.4.eng: The monks who were friends heard about this

pli-tv-kd4:17.1.5.pli: “amhākaṃ kira sāmantā aññe bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā vassaṃ upagatā—

pli-tv-kd4:17.1.6.pli: ‘mayaṃ tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ vassaṃvuṭṭhānaṃ pavāraṇāya pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapessāmā’ti.

pli-tv-kd4:17.2.1.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, sambahulā sandiṭṭhā sambhattā bhikkhū aññatarasmiṃ āvāse vassaṃ upagacchanti.

pli-tv-kd4:17.2.2.pli: Tesaṃ sāmantā aññe bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā vassaṃ upagacchanti—

pli-tv-kd4:17.2.3.pli: ‘mayaṃ tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ vassaṃvuṭṭhānaṃ pavāraṇāya pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapessāmā’ti.

pli-tv-kd4:17.2.4.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tehi bhikkhūhi dve tayo uposathe cātuddasike kātuṃ—
pli-tv-kd4:17.2.4.eng: I allow those monks to do two or three observance-day ceremonies on the fourteenth day,

pli-tv-kd4:17.2.5.eng: with the aim of having their invitation ceremony before the other monks.

pli-tv-kd4:17.2.6.pli: Te ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā taṃ āvāsaṃ āgacchanti, tehi, bhikkhave, āvāsikehi bhikkhūhi lahuṃ lahuṃ sannipatitvā pavāretabbaṃ, pavāretvā vattabbā—
pli-tv-kd4:17.2.6.eng: If those quarrelsome and argumentative monks are on their way to the other monastery, the resident monks should gather quickly and do the invitation ceremony. When it has been done, they should say to the other monks,

pli-tv-kd4:17.2.7.eng: ‘Venerables, we have completed the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:17.2.8.eng: Please do as you see fit.’

pli-tv-kd4:17.3.1.pli: Te ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā asaṃvihitā taṃ āvāsaṃ āgacchanti, tehi, bhikkhave, āvāsikehi bhikkhūhi āsanaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, pādodakaṃ pādapīṭhaṃ pādakathalikaṃ upanikkhipitabbaṃ, paccuggantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetabbaṃ, pānīyena paripucchitabbā;
pli-tv-kd4:17.3.1.eng: If those quarrelsome and argumentative monks arrive without prior notice, the resident monks should prepare seats and set out a foot stool, a foot scraper, and water for washing the feet. They should then go out to meet those monks, receive their bowls and robes, and ask if they want water to drink.

pli-tv-kd4:17.3.2.pli: tesaṃ vikkhitvā nissīmaṃ gantvā pavāretabbaṃ, pavāretvā vattabbā—
pli-tv-kd4:17.3.2.eng: Then, having distracted them, they should go outside the monastery zone and do the invitation ceremony there. When it has been done, they should say to the other monks,

pli-tv-kd4:17.3.3.eng: ‘Venerables, we have completed the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:17.3.4.eng: Please do as you see fit.’

pli-tv-kd4:17.4.1.eng: If they’re able to do this, it’s good.

pli-tv-kd4:17.4.2.pli: No ce labhetha, āvāsikena bhikkhunā byattena paṭibalena āvāsikā bhikkhū ñāpetabbā—
pli-tv-kd4:17.4.2.eng: If not, then a resident monk who is competent and capable should inform the resident monks:

pli-tv-kd4:17.4.3.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the resident monks to listen.

pli-tv-kd4:17.4.4.pli: Yadāyasmantānaṃ pattakallaṃ, idāni uposathaṃ kareyyāma, pātimokkhaṃ uddiseyyāma, āgame kāḷe pavāreyyāmā’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:17.4.4.eng: If the venerables are ready, we’ll now do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code, and we’ll do the invitation ceremony during the next waning phase of the moon.’

pli-tv-kd4:17.4.5.pli: Te ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā te bhikkhū evaṃ vadeyyuṃ—
pli-tv-kd4:17.4.5.eng: If the quarrelsome and argumentative monks say,

pli-tv-kd4:17.4.6.pli: ‘sādhāvuso, idāneva no pavārethā’ti, te evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd4:17.4.6.eng: ‘Please do the invitation ceremony with us now,’ they should be told,

pli-tv-kd4:17.4.7.eng: ‘You have no authority over our invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:17.4.8.eng: We won’t do the procedure for the time being.’

pli-tv-kd4:17.5.1.pli: Te ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā taṃ kāḷaṃ anuvaseyyuṃ, āvāsikena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā byattena paṭibalena āvāsikā bhikkhū ñāpetabbā—
pli-tv-kd4:17.5.1.eng: If the quarrelsome and argumentative monks stay on until the new moon, then a resident monk who is competent and capable should inform the resident monks:

pli-tv-kd4:17.5.2.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the resident monks to listen.

pli-tv-kd4:17.5.3.pli: Yadāyasmantānaṃ pattakallaṃ, idāni uposathaṃ kareyyāma, pātimokkhaṃ uddiseyyāma, āgame juṇhe pavāreyyāmā’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:17.5.3.eng: If the venerables are ready, we’ll now do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code, and we’ll do the invitation ceremony during the next waxing phase of the moon.’

pli-tv-kd4:17.5.4.pli: Te ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā te bhikkhū evaṃ vadeyyuṃ—
pli-tv-kd4:17.5.4.eng: If the quarrelsome and argumentative monks say,

pli-tv-kd4:17.5.5.pli: ‘sādhāvuso, idāneva no pavāreyyāthā’ti, te evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-kd4:17.5.5.eng: ‘Please do the invitation ceremony with us now,’ they should be told,

pli-tv-kd4:17.5.6.pli: ‘anissarā kho tumhe, āvuso, amhākaṃ pavāraṇāya, na tāva mayaṃ pavāreyyāmā’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:17.5.6.eng: ‘You have no authority over our invitation ceremony. We won’t do the procedure for the time being.’

pli-tv-kd4:17.6.1.pli: Te ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhaṇḍanakārakā kalahakārakā vivādakārakā bhassakārakā saṅghe adhikaraṇakārakā tampi juṇhaṃ anuvaseyyuṃ, tehi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi sabbeheva āgame juṇhe komudiyā cātumāsiniyā akāmā pavāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:17.6.1.eng: If the quarrelsome and argumentative monks stay on until the next full moon, then all the monks have no choice but to do the invitation ceremony on the day of Komudī, the fourth full moon of the rainy season.”

pli-tv-kd4:17.7.1.pli: Tehi ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi pavāriyamāne gilāno agilānassa pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, so evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:17.7.1.eng: “If, while you’re doing the invitation ceremony, a sick monk cancels the invitation of a healthy monk, you should tell him,

pli-tv-kd4:17.7.3.eng: The Buddha has said that a sick monk can’t endure being questioned.

pli-tv-kd4:17.7.5.eng: If you then wish, you may accuse him.’

pli-tv-kd4:17.7.6.eng: If, in spite of this, he still accuses the other, he commits an offense entailing confession for disrespect.

pli-tv-kd4:17.8.1.pli: Tehi ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi pavāriyamāne agilāno gilānassa pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, so evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:17.8.1.eng: If, while you’re doing the invitation ceremony, a healthy monk cancels the invitation of a sick monk, you should tell him,

pli-tv-kd4:17.8.3.eng: The Buddha has said that a sick monk can’t endure being questioned.

pli-tv-kd4:17.8.4.pli: Āgamehi, āvuso, yāvāyaṃ bhikkhu arogo hoti.

pli-tv-kd4:17.8.5.eng: If you then wish, you may accuse him.’

pli-tv-kd4:17.8.6.eng: If, in spite of this, he still accuses the other, he commits an offense entailing confession for disrespect.

pli-tv-kd4:17.9.1.pli: Tehi ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi pavāriyamāne gilāno gilānassa pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, so evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:17.9.1.eng: If, while you’re doing the invitation ceremony, a sick monk cancels the invitation of a sick monk, you should tell him,

pli-tv-kd4:17.9.3.eng: The Buddha has said that a sick monk can’t endure being questioned.

pli-tv-kd4:17.9.4.eng: Please wait until you’re both healthy.

pli-tv-kd4:17.9.5.eng: If you then wish, you may accuse him.’

pli-tv-kd4:17.9.6.eng: If, in spite of this, he still accuses the other, he commits an offense entailing confession for disrespect.

pli-tv-kd4:17.10.1.pli: Tehi ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi pavāriyamāne agilāno agilānassa pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, ubho saṅghena samanuyuñjitvā samanugāhitvā yathādhammaṃ kārāpetvā saṅghena pavāretabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd4:17.10.1.eng: If, while you’re doing the invitation ceremony, a healthy monk cancels the invitation of a healthy monk, you should question and examine both and deal with them according to the rule. The Sangha should then continue the invitation ceremony.”

pli-tv-kd4:18.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā sandiṭṭhā sambhattā bhikkhū kosalesu janapade aññatarasmiṃ āvāse vassaṃ upagacchiṃsu.
pli-tv-kd4:18.1.1.eng: On one occasion in a certain monastery in the Kosalan country, a number of monks who were friends had entered the rainy-season residence together.

pli-tv-kd4:18.1.2.pli: Tesaṃ samaggānaṃ sammodamānānaṃ avivadamānānaṃ viharataṃ aññataro phāsuvihāro adhigato hoti.
pli-tv-kd4:18.1.2.eng: While living together in peace and harmony, they were experiencing deep meditation.
pli-tv-kd4:18.1.2.comm: Sp 3.241: Aññataro phāsuvihāroti taruṇasamatho vā taruṇavipassanā vā, “Aññataro phāsuvihāro means the early stages of stillness or clear seeing.”

pli-tv-kd4:18.1.4.pli: “amhākaṃ kho samaggānaṃ sammodamānānaṃ avivadamānānaṃ viharataṃ aññataro phāsuvihāro adhigato.

pli-tv-kd4:18.1.5.pli: Sace mayaṃ idāni pavāressāma, siyāpi bhikkhū pavāretvā cārikaṃ pakkameyyuṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:18.1.5.eng: and thought, “If we do the invitation ceremony now, the monks might set out wandering.

pli-tv-kd4:18.1.6.pli: Evaṃ mayaṃ imamhā phāsuvihārā paribāhirā bhavissāma.
pli-tv-kd4:18.1.6.eng: We’ll then lose this deep meditation.

pli-tv-kd4:18.2.1.pli: “Idha pana, bhikkhave, sambahulā sandiṭṭhā sambhattā bhikkhū aññatarasmiṃ āvāse vassaṃ upagacchanti.

pli-tv-kd4:18.2.2.pli: Tesaṃ samaggānaṃ sammodamānānaṃ avivadamānānaṃ viharataṃ aññataro phāsuvihāro adhigato hoti.

pli-tv-kd4:18.2.4.pli: ‘amhākaṃ kho samaggānaṃ sammodamānānaṃ avivadamānānaṃ viharataṃ aññataro phāsuvihāro adhigato.

pli-tv-kd4:18.2.5.pli: Sace mayaṃ idāni pavāressāma, siyāpi bhikkhū pavāretvā cārikaṃ pakkameyyuṃ.

pli-tv-kd4:18.2.6.pli: Evaṃ mayaṃ imamhā phāsuvihārā paribāhirā bhavissāmā’ti.

pli-tv-kd4:18.2.7.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tehi bhikkhūhi pavāraṇāsaṅgahaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:18.2.7.eng: I allow those monks to make an agreement about the invitation ceremony.

pli-tv-kd4:18.3.1.eng: And it should be made like this.

pli-tv-kd4:18.3.2.eng: Everyone should gather in one place.

pli-tv-kd4:18.3.3.pli: sannipatitvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-kd4:18.3.3.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-kd4:18.3.4.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd4:18.3.5.pli: Amhākaṃ samaggānaṃ sammodamānānaṃ avivadamānānaṃ viharataṃ aññataro phāsuvihāro adhigato.
pli-tv-kd4:18.3.5.eng: While living together in peace and harmony, we’re experiencing deep meditation.

pli-tv-kd4:18.3.6.pli: Sace mayaṃ idāni pavāressāma, siyāpi bhikkhū pavāretvā cārikaṃ pakkameyyuṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:18.3.6.eng: If we do the invitation ceremony now, the monks might set out wandering.

pli-tv-kd4:18.3.7.pli: Evaṃ mayaṃ imamhā phāsuvihārā paribāhirā bhavissāma.
pli-tv-kd4:18.3.7.eng: We’ll then lose this deep meditation.

pli-tv-kd4:18.3.8.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho pavāraṇāsaṅgahaṃ kareyya, idāni uposathaṃ kareyya, pātimokkhaṃ uddiseyya, āgame juṇhe komudiyā cātumāsiniyā pavāreyya.
pli-tv-kd4:18.3.8.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should make an agreement about the invitation ceremony: we’ll now do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code, and we’ll do the invitation ceremony on the day of Komudī, the fourth full moon of the rainy season.

pli-tv-kd4:18.4.1.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-kd4:18.4.2.pli: Amhākaṃ samaggānaṃ sammodamānānaṃ avivadamānānaṃ viharataṃ aññataro phāsuvihāro adhigato.
pli-tv-kd4:18.4.2.eng: While living together in peace and harmony, we’re experiencing deep meditation.

pli-tv-kd4:18.4.3.pli: Sace mayaṃ idāni pavāressāma, siyāpi bhikkhū pavāretvā cārikaṃ pakkameyyuṃ.
pli-tv-kd4:18.4.3.eng: If we do the invitation ceremony now, the monks might set out wandering.

pli-tv-kd4:18.4.4.pli: Evaṃ mayaṃ imamhā phāsuvihārā paribāhirā bhavissāma.
pli-tv-kd4:18.4.4.eng: We’ll then lose this deep meditation.

pli-tv-kd4:18.4.5.pli: Saṅgho pavāraṇāsaṅgahaṃ karoti, idāni uposathaṃ karissati, pātimokkhaṃ uddisissati, āgame juṇhe komudiyā cātumāsiniyā pavāressati.
pli-tv-kd4:18.4.5.eng: The Sangha makes an agreement about the invitation ceremony: we’ll now do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code, and we’ll do the invitation ceremony on the day of Komudī, the fourth full moon of the rainy season.

pli-tv-kd4:18.4.6.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati pavāraṇāsaṅgahassa karaṇaṃ, idāni uposathaṃ karissati, pātimokkhaṃ uddisissati, āgame juṇhe komudiyā cātumāsiniyā pavāressati, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-kd4:18.4.6.eng: Any monk who approves of making this agreement about the invitation ceremony—that we’ll now do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code and that we’ll do the invitation ceremony on the day of Komudī, the fourth full moon of the rainy season—should remain silent.

pli-tv-kd4:18.4.7.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-kd4:18.4.8.pli: Kato saṅghena pavāraṇāsaṅgaho, idāni uposathaṃ karissati, pātimokkhaṃ uddisissati, āgame juṇhe komudiyā cātumāsiniyā pavāressati.
pli-tv-kd4:18.4.8.eng: The Sangha has made an agreement about the invitation ceremony: we’ll now do the observance-day ceremony and recite the Monastic Code, and we’ll do the invitation ceremony on the day of Komudī, the fourth full moon of the rainy season.

pli-tv-kd4:18.4.9.pli: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:18.4.9.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

pli-tv-kd4:18.5.1.pli: Tehi ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi kate pavāraṇāsaṅgahe aññataro bhikkhu evaṃ vadeyya—
pli-tv-kd4:18.5.1.eng: If, when those monks have made an agreement about the invitation ceremony, a monk says,

pli-tv-kd4:18.5.2.eng: ‘I wish to go wandering in the country;

pli-tv-kd4:18.5.3.pli: atthi me janapade karaṇīyan’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:18.5.3.eng: I have business there,’ they should tell him,

pli-tv-kd4:18.5.4.eng: ‘That’s fine, but you have to do the invitation first.’

pli-tv-kd4:18.5.5.pli: So ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pavārayamāno aññatarassa bhikkhuno pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, so evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:18.5.5.eng: If, while that monk is doing the invitation, he cancels the invitation of another monk, the other monk should tell him,

pli-tv-kd4:18.5.6.pli: ‘anissaro kho me tvaṃ, āvuso, pavāraṇāya, na tāvāhaṃ pavāressāmī’ti.
pli-tv-kd4:18.5.6.eng: ‘You have no authority over my invitation until I invite.’

pli-tv-kd4:18.5.7.pli: Tassa ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pavārayamānassa aññataro bhikkhu tassa bhikkhuno pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, ubho saṅghena samanuyuñjitvā samanugāhitvā yathādhammaṃ kārāpetabbā.
pli-tv-kd4:18.5.7.eng: If, while that monk is doing the invitation, another monk cancels his invitation, the monks should question and examine both and deal with them according to the rule.

pli-tv-kd4:18.6.1.pli: So ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhu janapade taṃ karaṇīyaṃ tīretvā punadeva anto komudiyā cātumāsiniyā taṃ āvāsaṃ āgacchati, tehi ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi pavāriyamāne aññataro bhikkhu tassa bhikkhuno pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, so evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-kd4:18.6.1.eng: If that monk finishes his business in the country and returns to that monastery before the full-moon day of Komudī, and if, while the monks are doing the invitation ceremony, a monk cancels the invitation of the monk who has returned, the monk who has returned should tell him,

pli-tv-kd4:18.6.2.eng: ‘You have no authority over my invitation;

pli-tv-kd4:18.6.4.pli: Tehi ce, bhikkhave, bhikkhūhi pavāriyamāne so bhikkhu aññatarassa bhikkhuno pavāraṇaṃ ṭhapeti, ubho saṅghena samanuyuñjitvā samanugāhitvā yathādhammaṃ kārāpetvā saṅghena pavāretabban”ti.
pli-tv-kd4:18.6.4.eng: If, while the monks are doing the invitation ceremony, the monk who has returned cancels the invitation of another monk, the monks should question and examine both and deal with them according to the rule. The Sangha should then continue the invitation ceremony.”

pli-tv-kd4:18.6.5.eng: The fourth chapter on the invitation ceremony is finished.

pli-tv-kd4:18.6.8.eng: They went to see the Teacher;

pli-tv-kd4:18.6.10.eng: One another in the proper way.

pli-tv-kd4:18.6.11.comm: Paṇāma does not refer directly to anything in the text, and so it may be a corruption. I follow the reading of SRT: āsane, “in the seat”.

pli-tv-kd4:18.6.20.eng: Characteristics, belonging to a Buddhist sect, both;

pli-tv-kd4:18.6.28.eng: Because of the seen, the heard, the suspected;

pli-tv-kd4:18.6.33.eng: In this chapter there are forty-six topics.

pli-tv-kd4:18.6.34.eng: The chapter on the invitation ceremony is finished.
